Job_Title: Compliance Manager – MAS Licensed Payments Firm
Job_Descriptions: We are partnering a MAS licensed Payments Firm to recruit for a Compliance Manager. You will work with a solid team that is highly collaborative and passionate about the business. We are seeking a dynamic Compliance professional to join their growing company. Responsibilities Reporting to the CEO, you will be responsible for providing leadership to a small team in managing the Compliance function. You will design the Compliance strategies for the company and implement an effective AML & Compliance program. This includes developing the Compliance policies, standards, procedures and control and also playing a hands-on role in AML/KYC client-onboarding etc. You will be a trusted Compliance advisor to the business and work closely with various stakeholders to ensure risks are mitigated and the business is complying with regulations. You will act as the key point of contact with MAS and regulatory reporting matters and liaise with external auditors and law enforcement. You will play a critical role in instilling a strong Compliance culture across the company. Requirements You are degree qualified with 7-10 years of Compliance experience in Financial Service. You are a well-rounded Compliance professional with sound understanding of AML/CFT rules and regulations and hands-on AML/KYC experience. Diploma in Compliance/AML or ACAMS will be bonus. Some experience working in smaller firms or startups is highly welcomed. To succeed in this role, you must be highly adaptable, possess a strong sense of ownership, hands-on and thrive in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. Job_Title: Regional Product Manager (Market Leader in Animal Nutrition & Health)
Job_Descriptions: Our client is a market leader in the Animal Nutrition & Health industry, and am currently hiring for a Regional Product Manager position to be based in their regional HQ in Singapore. Responsibilities Reporting to the Regional Product Group Head, this position will be accountable for the products’ marketing activities and oversees the development and delivery of a marketing strategy for the assigned product lines of Immune modulator, Toxin binder and Trace mineral. The incumbent is further accountable to ensure that customers are fully satisfied with the product quality, technical support and services which lead to increasing the products’ brand footprint while staying relevant and true to its value proposition. The role will be responsible for proposing the selling price across Asia markets, and will be working with the Purchasing team to keep cost down and with the Logistic team to ensure timely fulfillment of orders by the customers. The role will also be required to engage frequently with key customers in Asia, and to maintain a clear understanding of market trends and seek out opportunities to ensure growth and profitability. You will be required to re-fresh yearly the marketing plan of existing products and manage incumbent products’ life cycle, while ensuring the timely launch of products developed by the R&D team. Requirements You will ideally have a Bachelor’s degree in Animal Nutrition, Animal Science or Veterinary Medicine, with at least 6 years of working experience in the livestock industry in a technical and/or management capacity. Prior hands-on experience in mycotoxin binders and/or trace minerals in both feed mill and on farm in Asia will be highly regarded. Regardless of whether you have had a technical or commercial path in your career so far, more importantly will be your ability to demonstrate strong product management and product marketing competency to venture into this role. You should have an entrepreneurial business mindset with a high degree of personal motivation, and being confident, driven, dynamic, creative and a problem solver. To Apply To apply, please submit your resume (in MS Words format) to Willis Toh at **@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number WT22316. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Registration No: R1104283 License No: 16S8060

You bring with you a strong network of and deep relationships with Korean subsidiaries of Global/MNC Corporate Banking clients in SEA and India. You have a proven track record in origination and driving execution of various financing solutions as well as managing a sizeable business portfolio. You possess strong credit skills and can effectively cross sell financing products and solutions to clients. You possess excellent communication and stakeholder management skills and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced large international organization. About BHP At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success. About the Role This role can be located in Perth, Brisbane or Singapore. The fun parts of this role include; Working with the Product Owner of the team to establish technical solutions to deliver against their roadmaps Drive technical discussions to ensure complex solutions are successfully deployed in the cloud Scoping and executing MVPs to validate technical hypothesis, and enable data driven decision making Work collaboratively with other Cloud Engineers & Cloud Architects Responsible for evolving the relevant product within the BHP Cloud Platform to ensure services remain current, relevant and secure at all times Remain up to date on new services, and roadmaps, from the major cloud providers Enable customers of the Cloud Platform to develop and deploy applications and data-enabled use cases securely and quickly Drive automation and DevSecOps approaches throughout the platform to ensure security and self-service is promoted About You You will be a technical expert, who enjoys getting hands on to develop, test and deploy cloud related solutions through complex problem solving. As a strong team player you will be able to provide technical expertise and enable the team to perform optimally.  We are looking for those with the following STEM Bachelor’s degree highly desirable Significant expertise architecting and implementing large scale production workloads in the public cloud Significant experience using infrastructure as code and designing end-to-end DevSecOps pipelines Significant experience with cloud security, compliance and governance Experience communicating the differences in networking and security of on-premise and cloud infrastructure Experience with blast radius and hub and spoke topologies Experience with cloud native services and architectures Experience working with high traffic, high demand applications which require high availability Understanding of holistic enterprise architecture and interplay of analytical components with enterprise foundational components Expertise in at least one high-level programming language including e.g. Python, NodeJS or Java Capable as a mentor, collaborator, team player, and individual contributor in an agile setting Strong communication skills with ability to align stakeholders on complex technical decisions Experience with coaching and mentoring technical team members Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust Not afraid to “roll up the sleeves” and seeks to go outside comfort zone to learn – pushes teams to do the same Experimental mindset to drive innovation About our Process At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks. BHP also requires employees in Australia to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people (from the 31st of January 2022 or earlier depending on relevant state health directives). If you are applying for a role at BHP please consider this new requirement when submitting your application. BHP will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce. For further information please see our website (LINK) Supporting a Divserse Workforce The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance based bonuses and unique BHP employee share program.At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, people with disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.BHP is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability.

Come join us! Experience the excitement of working at one of Singapore’s most prestigious venues – The Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay! An award-winning Italian 2-storied restaurant with cosy interiors decked in industrial chic furnishings – with indoor, alfresco seating and a roof terrace overlooking the stunning Marina Bay waterfront. We are a progressive Italian restaurant which takes great pride in our inventive menu of antipasti, pizzas and homemade pastas, and a organic herb garden with over a dozen varieties. Top that with a calendar year full of exciting music, celebratory, dance, F1 and festive events filled with fireworks, and a fun-loving and energetic kitchen, service and bar team to work with - you’ll be immersed in the atmosphere of working at an amazing venue. Having fun is part of the job! Here’s the real job scope: Clean food preparation areas, cooking surfaces, and utensils. Wash, cut, and prepare foods designated for cooking. About BHP At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success. About the Role As a Cloud Architect, you will have three main responsibilities: leading cultural change for cloud adoption, developing and coordinating cloud architecture, and coordinating the adoption process. You will have a variety of technical and nontechnical skills, but above all, you must be a great collaborator in order to empower and connect with a variety of other architecture roles in the organization. You will build close relationships with Cloud Architects and Engineers within in the Cloud Team and with projects across BHP. You will engage with external stakeholders to provide technical guidance and advice to speed up the adoption of the platform aligned to our technology and cloud strategy.  This role may be based in Brisbane, Perth or Singapore. The fun parts of this role include: Engage early with Cloud project teams, including Architects and Engineers to provide advisory and expertise, to effectively influence the end to end migration process ensuring best practice and streamlined implementation of the Cloud strategy Engage with Cloud platform teams to ensure the platform capabilities, product and services roadmap meet Customer requirements Communicate cloud platform products and services effectively to stakeholders and other architects to ensure a secure and scalable approach to leveraging cloud is realised Interface and collaborate with other architecture functions and internal cloud engineering squads on best practice cloud architecture patterns Drive deep architectural discussions to ensure complex solutions are successfully deployed in the cloud and leverage cloud native architecture patterns where appropriate Enable and support customers to develop applications and data-enabled use cases securely and quickly Ensure applications migrated to the cloud are supported in a sustainable manner About You We are looking for those with the following: Significant platform experience including operational excellence, cyber security, reliability, performance efficiency, and cost optimization Significant experience migrating applications to Cloud, driving legacy application modernization and adoption of Cloud native solutions Significant infrastructure architecture expertise including capacity planning, environment strategy and hosting requirements Strong understanding of IaaS and cloud native solutions, incl. containers and serverless Significant experience using infrastructure as code and designing end-to-end DevSecOps pipelines Understanding of Cloud capability and application in a complex enterprise architecture and technology environment Strong communication and influencing skills with the ability to align stakeholders on complex technical decisions Expertise in at least one high-level programming language Capable as a mentor, collaborator, team player, and individual contributor in an agile setting Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust Not afraid to “roll up the sleeves” and seeks to go outside comfort zone to learn STEM Bachelor’s degree highly desirable Supporting a Diverse Workforce The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance based bonuses and unique BHP employee share program.At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, people with disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.BHP is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability.

About BHP At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success. About the Role As the Cloud Operations Lead you will own the Site Reliability Engineering capability within Cloud Factory team. This includes defining, establishing, and maintaining modern DevOps & SRE approaches, processes, culture, and agile ways of working within the Cloud teams. You will build close relationships with our offshore partner to ensure that the Cloud Factory supported platforms are operating in a reliable and efficient manner. You will drive the improvements in our operations team by leading automation initiatives, establishing data-driven metrics and observability, optimizing cloud usage, and tuning the operational performance. Working closing with the other product owners, engineers, and our offshore delivery partner, you will ensure that the cloud platforms is reliable and highly automated. You will have overall accountability for the successful adoption of modern DevOps in the operational support of the Cloud Factory. The fun parts of this role include: Evolve the cloud platform operations to be a highly effective function that operates highly reliable, integrated and automated platform for all our customers. Evolve and manage SRE improvement roadmaps and strategies. Build an inclusive culture and lead the SRE team by establishing the ways of working. Own the operational excellence of the cloud platforms. Shape the backlog: define, represent, and prioritizing streams and epics for SRE enhancements. Lead automation initiatives to enhance the stability and efficient of the cloud platforms. Lead initiatives to optimize cloud usage for reliability improvements or cost reduction purposes. Build data driven operational metric and monitoring capability. Work with our partners to streamline the engagement of high value resources that are aligned with the Cloud Factory delivery model and able to rapidly realize value for our customers Establish ways of working to ensure resilient cloud design and implementation practices are embedded into solutions during early stage of product life cycle development. About You Technology Stack SRE methodologies (preferred). Cloud operations experience. Cloud services: AWS and/or Azure Understanding DevOps practices. Skills and Experience 2-5 years of experience in leading cloud operations team, and/or SRE engineering teams, and/or cloud engineering, and/or cloud administration teams, and/or monitoring  & observability capabilities lead in an enterprise environment. Understanding of Cloud Automation development tools such as CI/CD, infrastructure as code. Experience in managing monitoring and events management workflows. Knowledge of Agile/Iterative development, test-driven development. Experience in Agile style ways of working Experience in working with multi-cultural and diverse teams Experience in working with virtual teams across different time zones Relentless drive to continuously learn new skills and improve About our Process At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks. Supporting a Diverse Workforce The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance based bonuses and unique BHP employee share program. At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, people with disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws. BHP is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability.

THE ROLE The Regional Conference Producer role with Lighthouse Independent Media offers an opportunity for anyone who is interested to pursue an exciting career in events and conferences. If you think you are very well-organised, with a strong commercial and entrepreneurial spirit, and enjoy taking pride and autonomy in your own work, this could be a perfect opportunity for you. The Regional Conference Producer will work on Lighthouse Independent Media’s leading publications’ flagship events with responsibility to deliver all aspects of conference content across a programme's life-cycle as well supporting these conferences with a stellar speaker line-up. This role comes with a high degree of responsibility for, and delivering end-to-end conference production: industry research, content development, programme planning, speaker acquisition, speaking management, copywriting and programme execution. OBJECTIVES The Regional Conference Producer’s primary objective is to take full responsibility for assigned events, create truly compelling content and work with sales, marketing and operations teams to deliver events that meet their financial targets and delight their audiences. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Develop programmes that would provide the best value to our sponsors and delegates pre, during and after the event through physical and digital channels. Learn and understand how virtual and physical events can be deployed to maximise ROI for our sponsors and optimise delegates/audience overall experience Build and maintain relationships with advisory panel, recruiting and managing high profile speakers, performing effective communication with sponsors and speakers’ bureau Identify and acquire compelling speakers of both technical and strategic (including c-suite) industry influencers and business leaders Introduce innovative and new format in conferences to inject excitements and wow factors for increased audience engagement. Work collaboratively with our in-house marketing team to drive marketing efforts and foster new media partnerships to increase event visibility and awareness. Take the lead on the sponsor onboarding process to ensure sponsors get the most value out of their investments in our programmes. Take part in regular internal project meetings to ensure effective communications with key stakeholders and project timelines are properly managed. Ongoing sponsors and speaker management to ensure all aspects of the conferences (physical or virtual) are executed to the highest standard and satisfaction of all stakeholders. KEY REQUIREMENTS Able to articulate with superior verbal communications skills. Good copywriting skills in the English language. Possesses strong commercial acumen and is extremely customer-focused. Comfortable conducting regular telephone calls and face-to-face meetings with senior industry leaders. Proficient at multi-tasking, working on more than one project at a time. Possesses an engaging, professional, and diplomatic demeanour. Passionate, dedicated, and able to produce profitable hybrid conferences. Able to exude confidence in handling internal and external stakeholders and demonstrate problem-solving skills Able to innovate, take calculated risks and think outside of the box to propose and execute new ideas Able to travel overseas, when required for event execution. Min. 1 year of experience preferred, but fresh graduates are welcome too. If you think you have what it takes to be successful at Lighthouse Independent Media, we want to hear from you. TO APPLY: Please email the HR Manager ********@lighthousemedia.com.sg, with your resume and cover letter, outlining why you want to join. Please note: We apologise but only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

THE POSITION This position of Quality Engineer/ Asst Quality Engineer is designed to make a significant contribution towards assuring the overall quality and consistency of the Company’s products and services. It’s a key role in the continuous improvement of the quality standards and compliances, and resolve customer quality issues. He/she will front quality discussions with customers. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES • Review all Incoming Inspection Reports performed by Quality Inspectors/Technician. • Prepare documentations for First Article approvals, technical drawings, Certificates of Compliance, RoHS. • Address customer issues in a timely manner and resolve quality issues and implement corrective actions to achieve customer satisfaction. • Update customers in a timely fashion regarding the status of quality issues. • Prepare and update all necessary quality reports as required by customers. • To resolve quality issues with suppliers that affected customers. • Work with Quality Manager to improve quality management system. • Maintenance of relevant quality records. CANDIDATE’S REQUIREMENTS • Diploma/Degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar. • 1 ~ 3 years’ relevant work experience, in customer quality issues. • Above 5 years experience could be consider for full engineer position. • Teamwork and able to multi-task. • Good analytical and problem-solving skills. • Pleasant personality and a good communicator. • Good command of Mandarin and English in speak/ read/ write. Pre-Sales Associate Who are we? Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed. We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents. A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. The Global Technical Sales Team (GTST) Talent Development Program: Are you looking to to begin your career in technology in a role with a clear purpose, clear direction, and clear foundations for growth? Our Global Technical Sales Team (GTST) are hiring and you will be a member our Talent Development Program. You will be a part of the next wave of talented individuals who have a mission to help improve the way we design and deliver technology solutions for our customers. This team will be a core component of our global pre-sales organization and will be responsible for many of the critical components required for us to design technology solutions for our customers. You will learn about our customers and their technology, build and document solutions that power the digital economy, connect the internet, and form the foundation of a hybrid cloud world. We want diverse people who are proactive and collaborative, who want to play their role within an amazing team and come to work every day with an open mind and sleeves rolled up. We will provide you with a platform for your career to thrive and accelerate, and the opportunity to complete a world class pre-sales training program backed by a defined learning path, certifications and support network of mentors, peers and leaders within Equinix. Some duties include: Support our team of seasoned pre-sales Sales Engineers and Global Solution Architects and perform functions necessary to move from initial customer engagement and requirements gathering, through to the design, configuring and implementation of Equinix products and services. Form a critical function of the team, driving process improvement initiatives and cadence with internal stakeholders to execute these improvements, as well as contributing to other business improvement projects. Take a lead in developing and capturing critical information which forms the foundation of our global knowledge repository and fuels our ability to deliver consistent solutions for our customers at speed. Requirements: Computer Science or related degree in Cloud or Information Systems or Engineering discipline Communication skills to work with various teams internally and externally A positive attitude and a growth mindset The curiosity to learn! Visit our Career page here to understand about Equinix COVID-19 Vaccine Policy.

Key Responsibilities: Be aligned with the Audience Engagement team ensuring the overall success for the division’s Programmes (Festivals, Exhibitions, Film Screenings, Performances, Others but not limited to Installations, Workshops and Talks, within and outside the Gallery). Be responsible for Programmes ensuring that quality, cost, health and safety issues, project administration and scheduling requirements are met. A key liaison between the Audience Engagement team and stakeholders, this portfolio requires the ability to work closely with and develop relationships with artists, arts producers, academic researchers, social service agencies, members of the public, government agencies, and corporates in the implementation of the Gallery’s Programmes. Coordinate and lead effective communication around the projects, ensuring that internal divisions and stakeholders have a clear view of its status. Plan, calendarise and work in collaboration with strategic partners to implement the Gallery’s programming plans. Responsible for building a travelling schedule for outreach programmes throughout the year, liaising with partners on the use of sites and other logistical matters associated with the programmes. Maintain and monitor project plans, project schedules and expenditures, and advise where required. Organise, attend, and participate in internal and external meetings with stakeholders. Coordinate and collaborate with internal divisions for project resources. Identify and communicate potential risks and roadblocks providing thoughtful and effective decisions. Ensures health and safety protocols in all projects. Ownership of all programme plans and drive adherence to them. Maintain governance and processes throughout the projects. Detailed Job Scope Collaboration and Coordination Work closely with artists, programmers, internal teams, and vendors to understand, detail, and coordinate the necessary resources for logistics support required to implement, manage, and sustain all Gallery Programmes and creative partnerships. Manage external consultants/vendors (designers, artists, exhibition fabricators, events company) and internal stakeholders, to obtain necessary information, verify details and deal with queries and difficulties as they arise. Responsible for coordinating both internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects; ensuring resource and space availability and allocation are secured. Develop project scopes and objectives involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility for implementation. Liaise with internal departments during all stages in the planning, organisation, and delivery of specific projects to ensure good information flow and smooth delivery of the Programmes. Project Management, Budgeting and Budget Forecasts Develop a detailed project plan and master schedule, which captures the timelines of various teams, for regular review, tracking and updates with the project team. Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope, schedule, and costs. Create detailed event schedules for all relevant teams, and ensure the smooth delivery of events, liaising with operations staff on logistical requirements and supplying information for preparatory work like venue set-up and rehearsals. Manage budgets and budget forecasts for allocated programmes. Monitor costs and highlight potential overspending to Project Director/Deputy Director. Tender and Procurement Processes Responsible for coordinating major tender procurement relating to the Project Implementation Review (PIR). Coordinate the process for invitation to tender for transport companies, external fabricators, external designers, and contractors among others; negotiate contracts with designers and contractors; ensure contract approval and negotiation support from in house legal team. Manage and administer procurement processes, payments, agreements, insurance, transport, and installation/de-installation requirements and in accordance with individual programme needs. Responsible for ensuring that all projects are procured in alignment with corporate procurement policy and delivered on-time, within scope and within budget, without audit observations. Programme Execution Coordinate Programme’s logistics for in-house and touring ones Coordinate display & documentation manual for commissioned works, to facilitate touring opportunities for Gallery generated touring exhibitions to other venues, in conjunction with the Deputy Director and relevant teams. Resolve production issues as they arise, as well as obtaining permits and other clearance documents. Coordinate film traffic and projection by securing on-time receipt of all films and media, liaising with projection staff to quality check presentation, and arrange for timely shipping of films to their next destination, resolving customs and print issues with film contacts as they arise. Coordinate a detailed maintenance plan for artwork commissions, watching over the safety and condition of artwork commissions, and ensuring that all artworks are properly maintained throughout the programme duration. Retain informed and up-to-date knowledge of developments relating to artwork logistics, insurance and indemnity, conservation and display considerations, and other matters relating to exhibitions organisation. Liaise with operations staff to prepare the venues for programmes, by carrying out tasks such as booking venues, obtaining necessary clearances for the installation and maintenance of equipment etc. Review and implement the procedures for front-of-house duties like ushering, ticket checks, ensuring Safe Management Measures are adhered to based on public health advisories at the time, supervising a team of volunteers and staff involved. Liaise with ticketing staff to create and manage ticketing modules for programmes. Risk Management, Fire, Health and Safety Perform risk management to minimize project risks. Report and escalate to Project Director variations and anticipated issues as needed. Adhere to Fire, Health & Safety regulations and agreed Gallery policies and practices and provide advice accordingly Where required, represent the team and department, as appropriate, at cross-organisational meetings such as operations meeting, disaster planning, induction, programme delivery, etc. Reporting and Survey Provide forecast and actual utilisation and availability reports and other management information, as required, and proactively drive resourcing decisions and positive behaviours. Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools, and techniques. Provide weekly progress updates for all projects to Deputy Director. Monitor and track project visitorship targets and desired audience development outcomes as part of project delivery and provide a weekly update to Deputy Director. Work with team to ensure short surveys are carried out for each programme and audience feedback and impact for all programmes are properly documented, compiled, and analysed. Documentation and Review Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation for organisational and audit purposes. Ensuring that Project Implementation Review (PIR) is prepared, presented, and approved by MC within 3 months of the project's completion; and tabled for information to Board within 6 months of the project's completion. Other Duties Business Continuity Champion for the division; supporting the division in maintaining and updating relevant processes and procedures within Business Continuity Plan (BCP) annual. Support Resource Management team to prepare project progress reports to be submitted to D/ADE and ensure data is accurately entered in the database. Support Resource Management Team in enforcing Knowledge Management policies, procedures, and guidelines, including filing and storage of key agreements, contracts, documents, and project folders. Support Resource Management Team in audit matters pertaining to projects. Must be able to work evenings, weekends, and public holidays when necessary. Any other duties as assigned. Qualifications At least 6 years of relevant work experience in an arts-related portfolio, including facilitating audience-centred content and public programmes Keen interest in arts-based community engagement and producing accessible, inclusive art experiences for a wider spectrum of audiences, especially those new to visual art Possess excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills to a broad audience base and diverse range of stakeholders Possess experience with the processes required to plan, develop, and present engaging arts experiences in public spaces, including non-traditional arts spaces Ability to manage projects effectively and deliver quality outcomes within tight timelines and budget A proactive team player who is people-oriented, meticulous, resourceful, hands-on, and able to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment Have problem solving ability. Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite is essential A good command of written and spoken English is essential

As a University of Applied Learning, SIT works closely with industry in our research pursuits. Our research staff will have the opportunity to be equipped with applied research skill sets that are relevant to industry demands while working on research projects in SIT. The primary responsibility of this role is to deliver on an industry innovation research project where you will be part of the research team to develop/produce/investigate 5G technology for indoor and outdoor localization and navigation. Key Responsibilities: We are looking for suitable candidates to develop localization solutions using 5G network for both indoor and outdoor navigation systems. You shall be required to perform research into the different techniques are suitable for localization. You will use modeling and simulation tools to perform tests on the selected designs and perform trade-off studies and comparative evaluation of the different designs. You should have deep knowledge of communications hardware and techniques for radio ranging, possess an aptitude in communications engineering and experience in designing software and hardware systems. Your responsibilities shall include: Conduct research to determine the parameters for designing localization system Develop metrics to evaluate the different designs Determine the key parameters needed to size up computation power for specific application. Design and develop prototypes and work on necessary components Perform integration tests and quality control Evaluate and improve design based on tests and experiment data Create complete documentation Troubleshoot defects in the design Keep abreast of advancements in communications and relevant fields Carry out Risk Assessment, and ensure compliance with Work, Safety and Health Regulations. Coordinate procurement and liaison with vendors/suppliers. Work independently, as well as within a team, to ensure proper operation and maintenance of equipment. If you also have a great deal of resourcefulness and a vision about what your machines can do, we would like to meet you. Candidates with good bachelor’s degree and postgraduate degree may apply for this position. Job Requirements: Well-versed in communications Excellent knowledge of software programming Ability to develop and evaluate integrated systems An analytical mind Resourcefulness Outstanding communication skills Good bachelor’s degree or post graduate degree in Engineering Prior industry experience helpful but not necessary

Job_Title: Internship - Procurement & Supply Chain Strategy MBA, Summer 2022
Job_Descriptions: Internship - Procurement & Supply Chain Strategy MBA, Summer 2022 – Singapore Everything in Dell Technologies is ground-breaking, from the designers of our products to the developers of our supply systems. The Global Operations (GO) organization within Dell drives the development, implementation and management of operations and suppliers in the delivery of strategic programs. We focus our resources on the continuous improvement of the movement of materials through production processes and establishing key performance metrics and benchmarks relating to supply chain planning and forecasting. The Procurement & Supply Chain Strategy arm within GO is a team of in-house strategists working together with the business on key strategic initiatives in the areas of supply chain and procurement efficiency. Work is typically organized around project-based engagements and you will be working with talents from various backgrounds, including but not limited to management consultants, research analysts, supply chain experts and marketing professionals. You will work on 1-2 projects, and the focus could be one of the following Working closely with senior leadership on a wide range of critical issues related to supply chain and procurement efficiency, and supporting senior executive communications for internal and external audiences Developing commodity sourcing strategy using qualitative and quantitative research to help shape Dell’s growth strategy Devising continuity of supply strategies for a particular commodity or product family through rigorous, fact-based analyses, reports, and recommendations This position offers Opportunity to learn about Dell’s latest innovations and client base and drive cutting-edge strategies for one of the industry’s largest technology companies Access to functional and industry experts through executive speaker series, lunch-n-learns and coffee chats Potential full-time offer post internship completion Our requirements are MBA Candidate graduating in 2022/2023 with strong academic credentials (minimum GPA 3.5/4.0) and leadership roles in clubs or extra-curricular activities 2 years of full-time work experience in management consulting, strategy, research, client management or banking roles Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills; VBA programming is a plus Analytical skills to conduct scenario analysis, build and validate business case, and make data-driven decisions Interpersonal skills to engage stakeholders, resolve conflicts, and manage ambiguity/ complexity Story-lining and presentation skills to clearly frame and communicate messages Project management skills to drive end-to-end solutions to complex problems Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Job_Title: Facilities System Engineer (MNC/ Pharma/ 1 year contract)
Job_Descriptions: A global pharmaceutical is looking for: • Senior Facilities System Engineer • Contract Duration: 12 months Responsibilities: • Mentor, train and support a team of System Engineers for the Plant Engineering function. • Advise and support the necessary qualification required for new utilities equipment installation and ensure adequate preventive maintenance is created subsequently as well. • Identify and put up recommendation in the CAPEX plan for any equipment replacement and overhaul based on the existing condition or end of life usage. • Mentor of the junior engineer for the following systems: o Heating, ventilation and air-conditioning (HVAC) for GMP and non-GMP environment and freezer o Black and clean utilities including city water, plant steam, instrument air, process air, special gasses (oxygen, carbon dioxide, Nitrogen), RO, WFI, clean steam o Wastewater treatment plant o Processed chilled water o Acid and Caustic CIP system o Laminar flow hood • Lead and manage change control on project activities or act as technical advisor for plant modifications, capital projects and other identified plant improvement projects in line with defined specifications, budget and qualification of facilities in accordance with site to approved procedures. • Lead or support investigation, participate in trouble shooting and root cause analysis for various operational events, and also ensure that all relevant engineering CAPA are completed within agreed timeline. • Act as the site utilities representative for any global committee • Responsible for the review and provide site inputs to the review of utilities related SOP from DP. • Monitor and enforce compliance measures within their specific discipline to ensure inspection readiness of the site, as well as participate as an audit team member (Utilities SME) in the conduct of audits. • Responsible for performing utilities load evaluation of any new equipment and facility installation / modification project, providing technical input to projects which utilities is involved. • Contribute to the development of the annual operating budget of the Utilities to ensure achievement of the operational targets. • Responsible for planning and implementing plant maintenance, managing of engineering resources during plant turnaround and annual shutdown. • Owner of P&ID drawings for the Utilities System and ensure the review of engineering documents and drawings are performed regularly. • Responsible for notifying Management in a timely manner of regulatory inspections, serious EHS/GMP deficiencies. • Responsibility to adhere to any applicable EHS requirements. Requirements: • Candidate must possess at a Degree in Mechanical/Chemical/Electrical/Instrumentation engineering or equivalent • Candidate must have at least 7 years of experience in equipment maintenance activities in a Utility Complex/WWTP/manufacturing environment. • Good knowledge in operation and maintenance of utility equipment; familiarity with P&ID, control philosophy, SOP for anaerobic, aerobic wastewater treatment and membrane wastewater treatment processes • Must have knowledge of process improvement and reliability engineering principles, methodologies and tools such as PDCA, LEAN, Six Sigma / DMAIC, RCFA, FMEA. • Management experience in leading a team of engineers Kindly forward your updated resume in Microsoft Word format to *****@novexx.com.sg We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified. Sales Operations Analyst I Who are we? Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed. We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents. A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. Job Profile Summary The role will work closely with multiple internal cross functional teams globally and regionally and deliver value by supporting proactively the monthly backlog exercise and providing analytical advisory. Responsibilities Core Determine and apply appropriate methodologies and tools to analyze a range of standard, functional and/or cross-functional issues/gaps. Design and prepare the backlog orders metrics/dashboard to provide visibility on the backlog progress to multiple cross-functional teams. To collect data various reporting data souce/setup e.g. Siebel, Tableau, Smartsheet etc. and provide the monthly backlog result / analysis for regional business analysts and Sales Management (globally). Provide overall support and coordination with regional backlog business analyst for the monthly backlog exercise. Responsible for implementing and enforcing processes and tools that will maintain integrity and accuracy of backlog process and data. To support standard reporting cycles in standard formats on daily, weekly, or monthly basis. Supports status reporting providing periodic project updates, communicating identified risks, issues and concerns. Execute ad-hoc analysis as needed with minimum supervision or support from others. Process and Policy Adoption and Reinforcement Educate backlog team on new tools/monthly backlog tracker, processes, and policies. Delivers refresher trainings to address knowledge gaps. Communicate process improvements and enhancements to cross functional teams. Project Management Supports project plans and resources, tracking timelines and ensuring status updates are periodically communicated Coordinates with stakeholders to facilitate alignment through implementation and post-implementation stages Identify risks/issues and proactively initiate discussions on workaround and permanent solutions. Coordinate cross functional discussions to drive issues, challenges and prioritization efforts Requirement Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or equivalent Prior work experience of at least 2 year in data analysis is required Knowledge in data analytical tools, statistical tools, and/ or mathematical models Ability to work proactively and independently to interact with stakeholders, understand needs, and present findings, and documents with clarity verbally and written Experience documenting specifications, such as source to target mappings, and business rule and data validation requirements Experience in testing and data quality assurance Bring critical insights and suggestions for continual improvement into process and solution design. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint, SQL and reporting tools Self-driven team player with ability to learn quickly, and apply new tools and techniques Meticulous and able to pick up fast. .​ Visit our Career page here to understand about Equinix COVID-19 Vaccine Policy.

Job_Title: Boomi - APJ Talent Sourcer (1 year contract)
Job_Descriptions: Are you ready to work on world changing technologies? Today, organizations need to move with increased agility and insight to grow and thrive. Boomi is one of the hottest tech companies in the SaaS/Cloud industry, named a Leader for the eighth year in a row in the Gartner Enterprise iPaaS Magic Quadrant and recently recognized by Inc. Magazine as one of the best workplaces. Our award-winning, patented technology is transforming the world of integration by making enterprise-class integration technology accessible and affordable to companies of all sizes. Boomi provides the foundation on which your business can evolve and innovate. According to a recent survey by Vanson Bourne, connected businesses are far outpacing their competitors. We help organizations connect everything and engage everywhere across any channel, device or platform. More than 17,000 customers are using Boomi to run better, faster and smarter. Working at Boomi means doing what you love. We hire trailblazers with an entrepreneurial spirit who can solve challenging problems, make a real impact in technology and want to build something big. Supporting ISEAA region, with emphasis on countries: India, Australia, Singapore, Taiwan. Exposure to digital marketing practices across SEO/SEM (Google AdWords), virtual event hosting platforms (i.e. WebEx) and email systems (i.e. Pardot) would be highly preferred. Responsibilities: As the first technical interaction between a prospective Customer and the Company. Acting as an important link between Marketing and Sales, enabling improvements in Sales and Marketing effectiveness, Sales and Marketing alignment and communications in a B2B environment. Qualifies the sales readiness of all potential sales prospects, qualify incoming leads and distribute them according to established rules and guidelines. Qualified sales leads will be converted to opportunities and passed to the Field Sales team and some may be managed internally by the Inside Sales group. Ensure the data collected during a qualification is accurately entered into systems. This data should be entered in a detailed fashion that is compatible with established data analysis techniques. Collaborate with other functional areas like Account Managers, Technical Specialists, Customer Support, Applications, Database Administrators, Marketing, and Upper Management. These interactions are often focused on moving sales opportunities forward and/or learning of new sales opportunities to pursue. Support Marketing activities within the region - coordinating and promotion of local Marketing events, translation and localization of content, web and digital marketing to drive traffic and conversions on Website. Maintains and build upon the professional image of the Company. Works closely with Manager and stakeholders to implement the specific strategy to drive business. Requirements: Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant disciplines. At least 6 or more years of relevant Sales/Inside Sales and Marketing experience , ideally in a B2B environment . Experience in Salesforce. A strong communicator, both written and verbal; bilingual in Chinese (able to read/write fluently in Traditional Chinese) to liaise with Chinese speaking stakeholders/customers . Excellent business writing skills which would be include, but is not limited to, conversing with potential customers to establish a mutually beneficial dialogue, writing email responses, maintaining information in a database, and preparing reports. Technical savvy; must be able to understand the technologies offered by the Company and relate them to the proposed applications of potential customers. Good understanding of the physical sciences. Exposure to digital marketing practices across SEO/SEM (Google AdWords), virtual event hosting platforms (i.e. WebEx) and email systems (i.e. Pardot) would be highly preferred. Attention to details. Business savvy and self-motivated. Resourceful in generating interest for our solutions. Willingness to learn and try new Marketing and Sales initiatives to drive engagement within the region. Ability to multi-task and self-manage, working across different departments and countries both locally and within Global headquarters. Other Information: Working Location: East. Mandai Wildlife Group is dedicated to caring for the planet and protecting animals and nature. Conservation education is intrinsic in all interactions with the Group, to inspire action for a healthier world. Mandai Wildlife Group is the steward of Mandai Wildlife Reserve, a unique wildlife and nature destination in Singapore that is home to world-renown wildlife parks which connect visitors to the fascinating world of wildlife. The Group is driving an exciting rejuvenation plan at Mandai Wildlife Reserve, adjacent to Singapore’s Central Catchment Nature Reserve, that will integrate five wildlife parks with distinctive nature-based experiences, green public spaces and an eco-friendly resort. Mandai Wildlife Group advocates for biodiversity, contributes leading wildlife research, develops innovative solutions to promote living sustainably, and collaborates with conservation partners in Singapore and Southeast Asia. The Group provides funding and in-kind support to Mandai Nature for conservation work across Southeast Asia. Mandai Global, an entity that is part of the Group, will establish and operate new lines of business anchored in creating positive outcomes for nature and wildlife. In our efforts to ensure a safe workplace, Mandai Wildlife Group implements the Vaccinate or Regular Test (VoRT) regime for team members who are not yet fully vaccinated. This is aligned to guidelines from the Ministry of Manpower and more information can be found here: https://www.mom.gov.sg/covid-19/advisory-on-covid-19-vaccination-in-employment-settings Main duties and responsibilities: Must be able to do coding development to maintain and enhance eCommerce system and websites using C#, .Net framework 4.5 (and above), JavaScript, HTML and MS SQL Server 2008 R2 (and above). Must be able to develop Restful API for Front-of-House systems. Provide day to day support, configuration, administration, problem resolution and performance tuning of Front-of-House systems like eCommerce system, MS Dynamics 365 CRM and Adobe Experience Manager Content Management System. Work with key business stakeholders for desired business outcome thru but not limited to gathering requirements and change requests, design solution, plan and manage solution delivery, project & vendor management, conduct user acceptance testing, documentation and training. Understand and upkeep the relevance of systems, processes and documentations. Duties may require occasional stand-by and/or provide support after office hours, weekends or public holidays. Any other IT related tasks assigned by Supervisor. Experience with Agile software development methodology Exposure to Devops concepts and tools, particularly those related to CI/CD Experience in Test Driven Development (TDD), and testing tool that supports Behavior Driven Development (BDD) will be desired Experience knowledge on Cloud-based Technologies and Services (eg AWS, Azure) will be an advantage Requirements: Minimum Diploma in Information Technology or related fields Minimum of 5 years of relevant working experience. Excellent analytical and organisational skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Eager and ability to learn quickly Experience and proficiency in any of the following in order of sequence will be highly valued: C#, ASP.NET, JavaScript, .Net Framework 4.5 (and above), API Services design, development of WCF services, REST API, Json. Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 and above (TSQL, DML, DDL, stored procedures and DB jobs) Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM Source code control systems Team Foundation Server and Github. Testing tools like JMeter, Selenium Unit Testing tools like MSTest, Unit, XUnit Adobe Experience Manager

Hiring_Company: Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine
Job_Descriptions: ACADEMIC FACULTY APPOINTMENT:  The Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine An Assistant Professor, Medical Education Research (Tenure-Track) will contribute significantly to medical education research, supporting the Medical Education Research and Scholarship Unit (MERSU) in its mission to become a leading centre of excellence globally.MERSU's focus is rigorous, theory-driven research which progresses understanding of individual, systems and societal influences on learning and performance, and then applies this knowledge to optimise the policy and practice of medical and health professions education.The appointee will also be expected to contribute to undergraduate and postgraduate teaching and support faculty in development of health professions education (HPE) research expertise. This position reports to Vice Dean, Education and Dean. Key Responsibilities Job Purpose: Contribute broadly to research in MERSU by developing and leading research projects which focus on extending knowledge about the human-technology-space assemblage in diverse learning environments Attract grant income, and produce good quality publications and other forms of dissemination Enhance collaboration with strategic partners locally, including healthcare partners and the School of Social Science, and also with established HPE scholars and research centres internationally Primary Responsibilities/Activities: Work with Vice Dean, Education to establish a strong qualitative research stream within MERSU To extend, through research, understanding of the social and material aspects of teaching and learning, and how individual factors, culture and contexts influence the processes and outcomes of teaching and learning Develop own research programmes which align with MERSU mission Support faculty to develop skills and expertise in HPE research Contribute to undergraduate and postgraduate teaching (e.g., supervising student projects, stimulating student interest in HPE) Work as part of a team dedicated to contributing to the quality of LKCMedicine's education and research. Job descriptions cannot be exhaustive and the appointee may be required to undertake other duties which are broadly in line with the above key responsibilities, as assigned by the Vice Dean, Education and Dean. Person Specification Qualifications, Knowledge and Experience: MBBS/MD and/or PhD degree(s) Relevant postdoctoral experience Significant experience and record of research publications in the field of health professions education (HPE) Teaching experience at either undergraduate or taught postgraduate level Management and Teamwork: Ability to lead and work as part of a multidisciplinary team Ability to work co-operatively with medical and non-medical staff and students Ability to supervise and mentor research staff and students Communicating and Influencing: Ability to communicate effectively with staff and students Ability to motivate others Strong dissemination skills Special Requirements: Experience and desire to participate in undergraduate and postgraduate medical education and training Time Commitment The level of effort for this appointment is at 1.0 full time equivalent (FTE) employment.

Job Highlights: An opportunity to be in a learning environment Passionate, energetic and innovative work culture Attractive remuneration package Job Summary: The Safety Coordinator will support the operations and projects teams in their efforts to comply with all the HSE regulations. This position provides safety-related advice, site safety supervision to ensure strict compliance and assists the HSE Officer in all HSE related matters during construction, commissioning, and operations phase. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Assist HSE Officer/Engineer in ensuring compliance of operations with Workplace Safety and Health/Environmental Control regulations and statutory requirement. To conduct daily site safety inspection and enforce compliance on prevailing MOM Safety Acts and Regulations and other requirements. Liaise closely with HSE Officer/Engineer on workplace safety, health and environmental issues to maintain a high level of safety at the sites. Enforce safety standards and assist HSE Officer/Engineer to implement workplace safety programs & safety initiatives. Attend audits and inspections as required by the Client’s Construction Manager. Assist to coordinate the PTW issuing and monitoring process with the host site PTW team. Carry out other duties as may be assigned from time to time by HSE Officer/Engineer or Project Lead. Requirements: Attended and completed WSQ WSH Level B course. Minimum 2 years of HSE experience in Construction and Industrial project. Excellent team player, good interpersonal skills, and a “can-do” attitude. Ability to multi-task in a fast paced and dynamic environment Candidate who possesses Confined Space Safety, Working at height Assessor Certificate and Safe Management Officer certificate will have an added advantage. Must be able to communicate with internal and external stakeholders. Working experience in Exyte projects will have an added advantage. This is a contract position.

As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or physical abilities. All offers of employment with GlobalFoundries are conditioned upon the successful completion of background checks, medical screenings as applicable and subject to the respective local laws and regulations.

At DSO, you will develop more than just a career. This is where you will make a real impact and shape the future of defence across the spectrum of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace. The DSO Digital Office drives digital transformation at the strategic level across Corporate & R&D Divisions. The Office develops policies for digital capabilities and data, leads capability development in data architecture and digital infrastructure, so as to transform the way we work, our workplace, and the capabilities we deliver to the MINDEF/SAF and for the security of Singapore. People are DSO’s greatest asset. You will get to realise your career aspirations and develop your own niche either as a deep technical expert or a leader in the team. With frequent career dialogues and a robust training and development framework, we will provide you with the necessary development tools for you to reach your potential. You will also be recognised and rewarded through competitive remuneration packages and scholarship opportunities. DevSecOps Engineer DSO Digital Office is implementing the next generation centralised computing and development technology stack to transform DSO’s core R&D capabilities. These include developing and operating central infrastructure for virtualisation, DevSecOps, data and AI. In this role you will: • Work with software lab teams to deliver robust DevSecOps services (e.g. onboard projects, automate pipelines) • Develop and maintain code to automate infrastructure and automation of compliance, logging, monitoring requirement and integration to designated code repository • Develop, build and release best practices as well as manage release and deployment services and jobs • Detect / predict / prevent release and security issues as well as manage processes and automation Requirements • Master’s or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Engineering / Computer Science / Electrical & Electronic Engineering / Information Technology / Software Engineering or any other related field • Minimum 1 year experience in software engineering, infrastructure engineering or related. Experienced candidates will be considered for more senior roles. • Good knowledge of DevSecOps process and best practices • Good knowledge of DevSecOps infrastructure and tools for all parts of the process (e.g. requirements and design management, source control, security analysis, build, continuous integration, config management etc.)

About GlobalFoundries GlobalFoundries is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GlobalFoundries makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets.  For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com Project Title Internship in Wafer Fabrication Process Engineering Project Objective / Purpose (Introduction) Wafer fabrication is the fundamental of all electronics and its applications in the semiconductor supply chain. Everything starts off with a bare silicon substrate, which undergoes many processing steps to form the ultimate IC chips that power up the electronics appliances. Controls are put in place to monitor the critical processing steps to detect any abnormalities early and to guarantee the wafer quality upon completion. Project Description Students will be attached to a Module and get to learn: Overview of the wafer fabrication process Purpose/function of this process module Front-end and Back-end processes Materials used in this process Controls used in this process the parameters monitored the Statistical Process Control (SPC) system What is a SPC chart and setting of control limits in SPC to detect any process drifts. Recipes used in the process - How to validate a recipe vs a golden recipe Shadowing mentor to assist the works inside the Fab Process Improvement: Analyze data and optimize the process. Project Outcome Interns will gain experience in the semiconductor industry, demonstrate a good understanding of the process module and able to do a presentation of the learning outcome. At the end of the internship, an overall report to summarize their learning experience with recommendations for improvement is required. Required Qualifications: Degree in Electrical / Electronics / Mechanical / Chemical / Material Science Engineering GlobalFoundries is an equal opportunity employer, cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We believe having a multicultural workplace enhances productivity, efficiency and innovation whilst our employees feel truly respected, valued and heard. As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or physical abilities. All offers of employment with GlobalFoundries are conditioned upon the successful completion of background checks, medical screenings as applicable and subject to the respective local laws and regulations.

Safety: To follow the safety procedures, rules and regulation and eliminate or reduce hazard at the work place. To identify hazards and implement effective risk control measures. To make sure the work environment is safe. To make sure adequate safety measures are taken for any machinery, equipment, plant, article or process used at the workplace. To make sure systems for dealing with emergencies is in order. Ensure sufficient instruction, training and supervision is provided to work safely. Follow the workplace safety and health system, safe work procedures or safety rules implemented at the workplace. Not to engage in any unsafe or negligent act that may endanger yourself or others working around you. Use personal protective equipment provided to you to ensure your safety while working. Job_Title: Regional Digital Marketing Manager - Sleep Segment
Job_Descriptions: You will be responsible for developing the overall company’s digital marketing strategy, planning and execution of digital marketing campaigns regionally. You will spearhead the brand’s aggressive and strategic shift to digital engagement and tasked with driving brand consistency across the Southeast Asia region as well as plan, organize, execute and measure marketing programs to generate increasing demand for new leads and help advance existing opportunities in partnership with sales, marketing and business development team. You will also lead and drive the products portfolio management in terms of market opportunities, positioning, pricing, initiatives and portfolio mix to increase revenue and profitability in Southeast Asia Specifically, you will Build, drive and implement the overall digital marketing strategy including contents, communication plan and execution of digital marketing campaigns Lead and manage various digital marketing channels. Measure, assess and report performance of all digital campaigns with defined ROI and KPIs metrics Drive the development of brand strategy and product positioning. Design and execute marketing campaigns, track their performance and sustain or refresh them as appropriate. Translate the Group’s strategic business goals into regional and country sales targets for various products, sales channels and set key performance metrics. Scan the operating environment, competitors’ activities and customer demand and keep up with developments in the medical equipment space to identify business opportunities. Drive the identification and implementation of new technologies to enhance business outcome and improve customer service and business processes Drive and oversee the training for sales, marketing and clinical application staff while also support the customers and users on an on-going basis working collaboratively with cross functional teams across the region. Manage suppliers in maintaining mutually beneficial relations with them while securing a good margin for the company You should possess a Degree in Digital Marketing, Marketing or Science and have a minimum 10 years of marketing experience with a proven track record in digital marketing and Go-To-Market planning and implementation in Southeast Asia region preferably in the medical products or consumer healthcare sector. To succeed in this role, you should be digitally savvy, data-driven and conversant in the range of digital marketing channels as well as be strategic, with a growth mindset, be result-driven and demonstrate strong ownership and initiative with strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal and influencing skills.
