Job_Title: Junior Data Scientist, Supply Chain (Data, Analytics and Automation)
Job_Descriptions: Junior Data Scientist, Supply Chain (Data, Analytics and Automation) Dell Technologies is a leader in providing technology infrastructure to its customers in an era increasingly being driven by digital and data. Enabling Dell to satisfy its customers’ needs hinges on executing a world class supply chain, connecting together sales orders with a complex ecosystem of partners and suppliers. Data plays an integral role in this as we digitize and modernize our supply chain. Join our Data Analytics & Automation team within Supply chain as a senior data scientist to solve our most challenging business problems with statistical, predictive and prescriptive approaches, making our decision making faster and more sophisticated. We offer a competitive remuneration package. In your first year at Dell Technologies, you will… Work closely with senior data scientists and supply chain domain experts to understand complex business problems and co-create solutions driven by data science models See your algorithms get scaled up and deployed, while learning from your mistakes Join a community of data scientists in discussing the current state of data science in the industry and sharing lessons learnt from past and ongoing projects Identify opportunities to innovate across the supply chain through our team challenges Craft and execute a personalized development plan with your manager to ensure you will continuously grow as a data scientist, while setting expectations on what role you could progress to in 5-10 years We seek data scientists with a passion to… Learn and apply database tools and statistical predictive models by analyzing large datasets with a variety of tools Ask and answer questions in large datasets and have a strong desire to create strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you Deep dive into data to find answers to yet unknown questions and have a natural desire to go beneath the surface of a problem Ask relevant questions and possess the skills to build algorithms necessary to find meaningful answers Creatively visualize and effectively communicate data findings and insights in a variety of formats Essential Requirements Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Data analytics or Data Sciences with 0 to 1 year of experience Relevant work/internship experience applying data science concepts in a business environment Advanced and theoretical knowledge of statistics and machine learning and application through statistical programming languages (e.g. R, and/or Python) Proficient in SQL Self driven, able to work independently yet acts as a team player Strong communication skills, willingness to learn and develop their ability to apply data science principles through a business lens Our team’s way of working We want to uncover ways to impact every key decision (in Dell’s supply chain) with a data science solution by experimenting together We use our curiosity to find latent opportunities. We work in an agile methodology and you will have the autonomy to suggest and work on alternative approaches. We target decisions that achieves our company objectives. Our solutions address important prevailing business problems and we continuously keep this in mind while progressing through our projects. We excel when we collaborate. Data scientists are encouraged to seek feedback from others and have open discussions while progressing through the data science lifecycle. Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin,(including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Airline IT Delivery Manager The role of the Airline IT Delivery Manager is to provide quality and consistency of on-going service deliveries for the full range of solutions and services contracted by Customer(s), and whenever is needed, acts as functional entry point to provide expertise on Amadeus products and solutions. Being active for a dedicated Customer or a defined set of Customers, throughout the lifetime of the customer, by mobilizing the appropriate line organizations to ensure Amadeus deliveries are on time, on cost and in line with agreed customer requirements, as well as to work with the other EAT (Extended Accounting Team) members to contribute and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction. Your main responsibilities include Understand the Amadeus strategy and vision around the full scope of Airline IT solutions and applying it to Delivery Management. Understand customer business, strategy, and challenges to ensure prioritization of deliveries in line with customer's needs. Assist Account Management in defining the Account Development Plan (ADP) according to agreed timing and standards. Develop existing relationships with both Customer IT & Business Management teams at the appropriate functional & operational level to reinforce & sustain strategic partnership with customers. Manage projects with quality & consistency, aligning all Airline IT deliveries needed by the customer. Monitor the customer performance against SLA targets and ensure Amadeus delivers the agreed service. Act as a central point of escalation for all recovery, resolution and delivery matters which include severe Incident and Problem Management records. Contribute to the elaboration of an action plan to ensure a sustainable high level of customer satisfaction. Proactively manage the ongoing pipeline & status of all functional and operational deliverables according to customer commitments & expectations, including standard solutions, bespoke development, consulting & other Services. Mobilize and coordinate line organization (product management, development, implementation, operations, etc.) to assure delivery of 1A commitments in line with customer expectations. Act as prime point of escalation for all ongoing functional and operational issues (e.g., CRs & Work Orders, PTRs, IRs). Create, manage and keep up to-date the Internal Airline IT Dashboard per customer in order to provide accurate status of all deliverables (functional, operational, cost & commercial), risks & issues. Contribute to the invoicing process of the delivered product implementation & bespoke development. Analyze customer solution and service requirements, propose improvements, identify up-sell opportunities and contribute to response to RFPs/RFIs. Support salesforce & Account Managers in the promotion & sale of IT Solutions to existing Altea customers. Assist the customer in formalizing any functional requirements, initiate the CP process, obtain sizing in due time, and build commercial proposal. Assist Amadeus Marketing and Product management in gathering Competitive information and in customer satisfaction survey. Facilitate high degree of interaction and actively share account information with Extended Account Team, Product Management, Implementation and R&D. Collaborate to knowledge creation, sharing and maintenance with commercial support teams (Portfolio Management, Sales Engineering, Legal, etc.). Identify, share and re-use functional Best Practices, experiences, and lessons learned within Airline IT and if appropriate with Distribution (through forums, calls, communities, etc.). Stay up-to-date with Product Roadmap and Portfolio expansion. Adhere to standard Delivery Management processes, procedures, tools and techniques. Participate in a continuous improvement process for measuring and improving performance, satisfaction and skills (via targeted training). About the ideal candidate Minimum Degree in IT, Computer Science or Business Administration with experience in Project/ Program Management or Business Solution. MBA will be an added advantage. Experience in airline industry preferred. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Possess a strong influence and conflict management with good project management and negotiation skills Ability to work with an autonomy and structured work approach while still reporting the activity at management level. Able to multi-tasks, to work with deadlines and manage pressure. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to hire the best candidate regardless of age, beliefs, disability, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation. Any duplication and display of partial or full content of our job advertisement on any support, such as brochures, websites, mail, emails, this list is not exhaustive, is strictly forbidden without prior formal Amadeus’ authorization. Amadeus is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Summary The Quality Control specialist, will be responsible routine quality control (QC) testing of raw materials, in-process materials and finished products. Responsibilities: Responsible for routine quality control (QC) testing of raw materials, in-process materials and finished products in a timely manner. Calibrate, maintain and/or troubleshooting laboratory instruments and provide support in the qualification/validation of protocols for process and laboratory equipment. Responsible for maintaining and engaging in existing materials management system. Responsible for assisting of analytical method development and validation, specifications of finished product that are in compliance with latest regulatory requirements and developing standard operating procedures (SOPs). Maintain records, prepare reports and compose correspondence relative to the work. Responsible to assist in research activities aimed at discovering novel imaging biomarkers, as well as limited-scale production of selected radiotracers for use in preclinical and clinical studies. Use, maintain and develop documentation in compliance with quality procedures and regulatory requirements. Qualifications: Diploma holder in chemistry or equivalent. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 1 year and above experience of working in analytical chemistry. Demonstrated skills with analytical instruments such as HPLC, GC, Gamma counter, UV/VIS and etc. Preferably previous working experience in pharmaceutical Quality Control. Preferably previous exposure to validation, GxP standards, EP, USP and or PIC/S Experience in managing people Dynamic and open attitude, ability to empower staff and have excellent communications skills. Requirements: Applicants must be fully vaccinated (according to MOH guidelines w.e.f. 14 Feb 2022). Asiaciti Trust is an international trust and corporate services provider. For 40 years we have delivered specialist fiduciary and administrative services to individuals, intermediaries and corporations. Asiaciti Trust has operations in Singapore, Hong Kong, the Cook Islands, Dubai, Nevis, New Zealand, Panama and Samoa. We are Asia Pacific focused with global reach, able to offer structures and solutions in almost any jurisdiction via our extensive international network. Asiaciti Trust was established in 1978 by our founder, Graeme W Briggs. Over time the Group has expanded steadily and is now one of the most recognised and professionally respected names in the industry. We remain family owned and fully independent. We take a long term view to strategic decision making, guided at all times by our core principles and the needs of our clients. By investing in people, infrastructure and our corporate culture, Asiaciti Trust commits itself to best in class service. We provide a stable environment, both internally and externally, engendering trust in our clients, business partners and employees. Our reputation and longevity are a testament to this approach. The Role As a Corporate Secretarial Executive, you would be part of a specialist Singapore Corporate Secretarial team that provides Corporate Secretarial services to external clients and internal clients (i.e. other departments within the Singapore business). Your Responsibilities Will Include Client Service Taking ownership of a portfolio of companies as assigned by the Manager and attending to the ongoing administration of existing client companies while ensuring compliance with statutory requirements. Acting as a point of contact for international clients to assist in the establishment of new corporate structures and ongoing administration. Assisting in the AGM process of companies, monitoring closely the statutory timelines for client companies and ensuring timely reminders are sent to clients. Attending to new corporate bank account applications. Attending to termination, liquidation and striking off of companies. Acting as a primary point of contact for liaising with the Accounting Department to ensure that financial statements are completed on a timely basis for companies under the candidate’s portfolio. Attending to the ongoing maintenance of corporate records for client companies. Attending to Employment Pass / Dependents’ pass applications. Attending to the redirection of emails to clients and any other ad-hoc administrative tasks that may be assigned by the Manager from time to time. Attending to the preparation and coordination of the corporate documents, including completion of filing with the relevant governmental authorities within the stipulated deadline. Regulatory & Compliance Attending to the annual compliance reviews for existing clients and ensuring any deficiencies that are raised during the reviews are attended in a timely manner. Having a good grasp of the Group’s internal policy and procedures and ensuring that the updated internal policy and procedure are strictly adhered to and complied with. Keeping up to date with ACRA and other relevant industry and jurisdiction developments from a legal, tax and regulatory perspective, with guidance from the Manager. Ideal Profile You have at least 2 years of experience in corporate secretarial/banking/ finance or regulatory industry with solid knowledge of the Singapore Corporate Law, in particular the Companies Act and familiarity with the corporate secretarial practice. You have strong organizational skills and can handle multiple tasks in a prompt and efficient manner. You are meticulous and pay attention to detail. You have an understanding and appreciation for client sensitivity regarding confidentiality. Hands-on experience or familiarity with the procedural steps of the various corporate transactions such as shares buyback, conversion of shares, merger and acquisition would be an added advantage. (Not a mandatory requirement as on-the-job training will be provided to enhance the candidate’s knowledge and experience). Note: Even if you are not quite matching the above requirements, but you think you would be a good fit for our team then please still contact us. We would love to hear from you and we will see if we can work something out where there is a good fit. What's on Offer? Work with one of the most trusted and respected international trust and corporate services providers. Opportunity to accelerate your career through a wide range of cross domain experience.

ABOUT US Ai Palette is on a mission to help CPG brands and Ingredient solution providers to create their next best-selling product by harnessing the power of big data using artificial intelligence and machine learning. Our market-leading predictive analytics SaaS platform allows product innovation and marketing teams across markets and categories to spot trends as they emerge and predict their trajectory, all in real time. The real benefit for them is more accurate insights, less risk, and shorter innovation funnels. We’re a Singapore-based company with an engineering hub in Bangalore, India. We are looking for smart, motivated, fun people to help us take our industry-changing solution to the next level. Is that you? What's it like to work at Ai Palette We're a technology startup based out of Singapore with an eclectic team of multicultural and multi-talented individuals driven to achieve the extraordinary every day. Our work is making a real positive impact on our clients’ and consumers’ lives around the world, and we’re leading the way in changing the world of insights as we know it. We face challenges together and we win together. And most importantly, we strive to deliver a world-class solution that transforms the way consumer products are created. Come and join us! About the job We are looking for someone who is passionate about Customer Success, Consumer Trends and Insights, and who has had a minimum of 5+ years experience in a similar role. We want you to start at the Director level, and head on up the ladder as the company grows. This role is perfect for you if you've 5+ or more years of experience working in a customer-facing role, preferably at a SaaS company, insights or market research company. It’s important to us that you have experience managing accounts and/or delivering strategic insights/advice to your clients, so you can hit the ground running. We’re keen on finding an individual who’s well-organized, autonomous and naturally obsessed by your customer’s success. You’ll be accountable for a list of clients, from global FMCGs to leading regional brands, most likely active across multiple markets and product categories. You’ll be responsible for your own strategy to delight them, keep them engaged and ensure they make the most of their Ai Palette, while finding opportunities to up and cross-sell. You’ll be a team of one, but will have the opportunity to grow your team as we grow. You won’t be working alone, however! We have a great team to support you and help you achieve your goals. We’re a driven group, but the working atmosphere is quite relaxed and friendly. RESPONSIBILITIES Ensure high-quality customer experience to new and existing customers Deliver consumer insights and trends recommendations Build strategic relationships and become a trusted advisor with your customers Improve platform and services adoption rate Maximize renewal rates and recurring revenue Effective and proactive problem-solving, internally and with our clients Contribute to the improvement of the customer success team and Ai Palette as a whole REQUIREMENTS 5+ or more years experience working in an account management role (or similar), preferably at a SaaS company, insights or market research company; we’re also open to candidates in a strategic advice role in a consulting or creative agency Successful track record working with large, multinational enterprise accounts Comfortable presenting consumer insights and trends Super organized: well-versed in project management and a stickler for on-time delivery Knowledge of CRM solutions and running tight account management processes IDEAL EXPERIENCE (ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING) FMCG Industry Consumer insights and trends (especially around food & beverages or personal care) Multi-market (Regional or global) or multi-category experience Training others to use a new product (onboarding) Building and managing a team Familiarity with big data, machine learning, statistics Executive presence, experience, and expertise engaging with senior business decision-maker BENEFITS Own what you do with access to our Employee Share Options Pool (ESOP) Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us! Look after yourself with health insurance including Hospital/Surgical, Major Medical and Outpatient Learn new skills with sponsored training Flexible work hours: Early birds and midnight-oil-burners rejoice!

Senior Service Delivery Engineer (CI/HCI Team) - Singapore Dell Technologies customers rely on our products and services to drive progress. So we take the service we provide extremely seriously. Service Delivery is all about making sure our technical solutions help clients fulfil their priorities, challenges and initiatives. As trusted advisors, we build in-depth knowledge of what each client wants to achieve. Then we make sure the services delivered by Dell Technologies deliver on all our promises. We also work closely with Sales and Global Services colleagues to develop strategic account growth plans, and to identify and pursue sales opportunities. Join us as a Senior Engineer on our Professional Services team in Singapore to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. What you’ll achieve As a Service Delivery Engineer, you will provide world-class delivery support to our customers by building an in-depth knowledge of our customers’ priorities and initiatives and becoming a trusted advisor that avoids customer impact and facilitates continuous improvement. You will identify potential sales and growth opportunities and will partner with key stakeholders to maximize these prospects. You will: Work as the Deployment Specialist for VxRail. Sync up with sales/pre-sales team and understand the solutions sold to customer. Work with customer to gather requirements and provide design and configuration based on customer requirements. Work with project managers to deploy and close the projects. Work with services sales team to provide scope of work and effort sizing for deployment services. Install, configure and test VCF, VxRail and Top of Rack (ToR) switches. Provide documentation on VCF, VxRail deployment. Provide brief knowledge transfer to customer IT staff after completing project deployment. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Minimum 5 years of experience on Vxrail design and implementation. Hands-on experience with storage solutions/products such as PowerMax, Isilon and PowerStore. Ability to manage multiple, often competing, priorities and tasks and follow through to completion on strict deadlines. Ability to effectively communicate technical information, both verbal and written, to a wide range of end-users, including non-technical users. Friendly presence and helpful attitude; good interpersonal skills. Technical and analytical skills are required. Desirable Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or 5 years equivalent experience is preferred. VCP-DCV or equivalent level of certification is preferred. Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here. About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Manage and analyse business requirements into a solution design, managing user requirements workshops and formulation of an overall solution design, modelling transactions through the system to ensure that the business requirements are met. Previous experience on implementing Fundamental Review of Trading Book (FRTB SA and IMA) SIMM(Standard Initial Margining Model), xVA is preferred. Strong team player with excellent communication & inter-personal skills. Strong problem solver who can question and understand proposed solutions and business drivers. This is an opportunity to join a highly successful sales team and a dynamic business unit that has grown incrementally over the past years. You will be a part of a highly motivated and enthusiastic team of sales professionals with a proven track record in B2B sales and client management. On the job training and support is available to develop your knowledge of the Foreign Exchange (FX) industry and our product. As a Business Development Manager, you will successfully acquire and manage relationships of a large portfolio of business clients in a highly competitive industry, where relationship is key. You will successfully manage new accounts effectively for the first 12 months in role and efficiently transition these accounts to the account development team thereafter. You will be expected to rotate your time between attending self-generated appointments, making daily cold calls, and manage the needs of your existing clients. In the fast paced FX markets nothing will ensure success more than a focus on productivity, service and enthusiasm. Minimum Qualifications: Strong level of financial acumen economic knowledge to facilitate meaningful discussions with 'C' level decision makers on a daily basis Relevant experience in corporate / business sales, financial services exposure is an advantage Proven track record in consistently over-delivering against a revenue target Team player who has exceptional presentation skills, time management skills and ability to work under pressure and meet allocated deadlines Self-motivated with abilities in influencing/negotiating with customers Strong ability to create long lasting consultative relationships with our clients Strong level of credibility and presence in front of prospects and clients Ability to liaise with Mandarin speaking clients will be an advantage Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations. Why American Express? At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

SingHealth Community Hospitals (SCH) Community Relations department is looking for Patient Activity Coordinator to coordinate logistical arrangements and facilitate patient engagement for virtual ward activities. Pre-Preparation of Activity The coordinator will ensure wards are equipped with materials required and IT equipment are set up for the activities. He/ she will ensure wards are informed of the activity schedules and distribute the right materials on the day of activity. During Activity The coordinator will coordinate with nursing department on transferring suitable patients for the activities and ensure safe distancing. Job_Title: Advisory Consultant (Cyber Resilience Services), Professional Services
Job_Descriptions: Advisory Consultant, Business Resiliency & Cyber Recovery Today, every organization needs to be digital, powered by data, running in a multi-cloud world, ready to take on anything. Our Consulting team assesses customer’s strategic, organizational and business challenges and uses in-depth industry knowledge to offer technical solutions that apply to future business environment and operational objectives to help our Dell Technologies gain market share and increase efficiency. Join us as an Advisory Consultant on our Consulting team in Singapore to do the best work of your career and make a profound bussines and social impact. What you’ll achieve As a Business Resiliency & Cyber Recovery Advisory Consultant, you will provide consultative and technical delivery leadership on a wide range of complex client facing consulting engagements which will enable our customers to protect and maintain the availability of their most critical business processes, applications, and digital assets. As a technical leader on the service delivery team, you will earn your clients trust through competence, expertise and partnership guiding them through advisory, planning, design and execution of high impact strategic business resiliency and cyber recovery initiatives. This position requires a dynamic individual with great customer facing skills to develop and articulate a broad range of business resiliency strategies and solutions to meet the customer’s strategic business and IT transformation goals. You will: Demonstrate passion, ownership, and accountability with a thirst for world class consulting Endeavor to become a trusted advisor to our customers and internal stakeholders through technical / business acumen, deep partnership, and outstanding results Leverage your in-depth technical knowledge to assist our customers in execution of their most critical business resiliency initiatives Lead enterprise wide client facing resiliency projects and programs as the lead technical SME in partnership with our project and program management organization Provide technical delivery expertise and leadership to the services presales process helping our presales/sales organizations scope and sell complex resiliency projects and programs Partner with service product management teams to enhance and develop business resiliency delivery collateral and toolkits Work in alignment with other consulting team members to determine the best solution options to solve our customer’s challenges Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements 12 to 15 years of related experience with 10+ years of progressive professional growth in a client facing services delivery role Ability to influence and interact with confidence and credibility at all levels within the Dell Technologies companies and with our customers, partners, and vendors Proven experience independently leading client facing delivery activities from presentations, workshops, and interviews to full scale enterprise wide technology services delivery Ability to articulate complex concepts, build consensus and deliver high quality work products Experience supporting services presales (scoping, estimating, and proposal development) initiatives in a high matrixed organization Adept at leading the design and implementation of highly complex systems with a focus on application availability, disaster recovery, backup/recovery, and cyber resiliency Solid understanding of: Enterprise architecture, infrastructure (network, storage, compute) as well as backup and replication technologies Legacy (including Mainframe) & modern application and database architectures with focus on availability and recovery concepts Experience with leading projects within a defined methodology while adhering to margin, planning and SOW requirements Desire and ability to travel domestically 50% or more (post pandemic) Bachelor’s degree from and accredited institution (Management, Computer Science/Technical); Master’s degree from and accredited institution (Management, Computer Science/Technical) is a plus Desirable Requirements Big 4 or equivalent management consulting experience Technical and Industry Certifications (CBCP, MBCP, CISSP, TOGAF, VMware VCP, CCNA, Microsoft, Dell/EMC or similar) Business Resiliency and/or IT Transformation industry experience in Financial Services, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Technology and/or Telecom Deep Expertise in three or more of the following areas: Assessing, developing, and implementing IT continuity strategies and programs, from business impact analysis (BIA) to implementation, testing and hand over to operations. Designing and deploying highly resilient application hosting architectures both on prem and across a multi-cloud ecosystem (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, and Azure). Planning, managing, and exercising large scale application, platform, and infrastructure disaster recovery tests and exercises Automating application recovery and failover/failback; CI/CD Pipelines and IaC concepts; Familiarity Agile delivery methodologies. Leading large-scale disaster recovery and/or application availability transformation initiatives Architecting and implementing isolated (air-gapped) cyber recovery solutions (recovery from a destructive/catastrophic cyber-attack) Backup / recovery architecture and design (DataDomain, Avamar, Networker, Isilon, TSM/Spectrum, Netbackup, Commvault, Veeam, and similar) Data / storage replication architecture and design (VMware, PMAX/SRDF, Isilon/SyncIQ, RecoverPoint, Zerto, NetApp and similar) Database availability and replication architecture and design (Oracle RAC, Oracle Data Guard, Golden Gate, SQL Replication, SQL Always On and similar) Mainframe resiliency architectures including IBM GDPS and/or EMC GDDR Enterprise open systems, mainframe, and/or cloud systems architecture and design Business Continuity Management and Planning, Enterprise Continuity of Operations, Incident Management BCM Frameworks such as ISO22301, industry standards including ISO/IEC 24762:2008, NFPA 1600 Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Job_Title: First VP, Enterprise Architect (CRM) | Group Technology
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Partnering with and acting as a trusted advisor to stakeholders in both business and IT to assist in defining and delivering high quality enterprise capable solutions Working closely with stakeholders to develop practical roadmaps to move the enterprise towards the future state vision, while taking into account business, technical and delivery constraints Analyzing stakeholder requirements, current state architecture, and gaps to create a future state architecture vision for one or more parts of the enterprise with a focus on reduced complexity, cost efficiencies, reuse, convergence, reduced risk and/or improved business capabilities Participating in defining and operating the architecture governance process to ensure change initiatives align to the vision and roadmaps Working closely with Domain Architects across key initiatives and projects to apply architecture principles and standards, and develop reference architectures and design patterns Communicating the principles, standards, vision and roadmaps to stakeholders and proactively addressing any questions / concerns identified Providing thought leadership on architectural or other topics, developing a forward looking view of current and emerging technologies and their impact on the Enterprise Architecture Embedding Platform Thinking in everything Job Requirements Bachelor Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent; Formal architecture certification (TOGAF or equivalent); Master Degree in Business or Technology is an advantage; At least 15 years' experience in the IT industry, preferably in large, complex enterprises At least 7 years' experience in Enterprise Architecture in a large, complex, multi-location, multi-national environment Deep experience delivering mission critical, enterprise scale IT solutions in a heterogeneous technology environment Familiarity with best practice methodologies and tools for the entire solution lifecycle from ideation to requirements, design, development, testing, deployment and operations A deep understanding of all domains of Enterprise Architecture, including the business, data, application, infrastructure and security domains Familiarity with one or more formal Architecture frameworks / methodologies (TOGAF, Zachman, BIAN, etc.) Familiarity with architecture governance frameworks Practical experience in data modelling, object modelling, design patterns and Enterprise Architecture tool or other software modelling tools. Practical experience to use business capabilities model Familiarity with heterogeneous technology platforms such as AS400, Unix/Linux, Windows IT Strategy consulting experience will be an added advantage Functional Expertise required in at least two of the below domains: Wholesale Cash & Payments Trade & Financial Supply Chain eChannels and CRM eco-system partnerships and API (Open Banking) Competencies Demonstrate deep domain expertise in CRM Domain Sales Managements: Leads, Opportunities, Task & Appointment Management and Account opening Customer Servicing: Single Customer View, Service Requests, Customer Interactions Customer Information management for Retail, SME and Corporate customers Across multiple touchpoints: Branch, Contact Centre, Sales teams, Front / Middle / Back Office Operations Technically strong in different integration mechanisms with open systems, AS400 and Mainframe Comfortable in working in an environment which is vendor intensive Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills to stakeholders at all levels Ability to communicate complex topics in an understandable way using a level of detail and terms appropriate to the situation Capability to think conceptually and identify patterns across seemingly unrelated situations Must be a good team player and able to drive consensus amongst stakeholders with conflicting viewpoints and objectives People and team management in a transversal function Possess strong understanding of business strategies and able to translate them into concrete achievable action plans Able to collaborate and drive motivation across a diverse slate within and across teams and can deal with difficult conversations effectively Owns and enhances workflows and processes, and delegates with clear accountabilities across the teams to meet objectives / outcomes Promotes an environment of learning and development. Understand and develop team members and others to achieve their professional growth Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Sr. Advanced Innovation and R&D Sourcing Manager
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Summary You are responsible for driving innovation through leveraging BD’s external partners as well as being accountable for the procurement work stream of highly complex, strategic new product development projects. This role will work in close alignment with global and regional sourcing teams to ensure BD is positioned well to provide innovative products and solutions to our customers longer term. In summary, this role will Collaborate with assigned business unit on their future product and technology portfolios and engage external partners to support the future portfolio Collaborate with category management teams and/or GP Business Partner teams to coordinate and execute supplier innovation summits Attend business unit Innovation Council and partnering with Business Development and R&D leadership Be accountable for the overall sourcing strategy for highly complex and strategic new product development projects, contributing to the projects’ commercial success as part of the GDPS core team Act as single point of contact and represent all aspects of strategic procurement for assigned new product development projects Manage 2-3 complex NPD projects and Advance Innovation area for EMI space globally.Job Description Who We Are BD is a leading global medical technology company that creates medical technology, devices and laboratory equipment for a variety of needs across the healthcare sector. At BD, we are looking for candidates who possess passion, innovative solutions and a commitment to our one mission of improving access to groundbreaking medical and biotechnology services for people near and far, delivering state-of-the-art technology and cutting-edge research in the battle to fight and cure infectious diseases. With a global reach that extends across 50 countries worldwide, our network of professionals collaborates on effective measures to deliver enhanced patient quality such as lower health care delivery costs, improved health care and safety, and expanded health care for all. Join our company and see how you can become a part of one global mission to make a difference in human health. Job Purpose You are responsible for driving innovation through leveraging BD’s external partners as well as being accountable for the procurement work stream of highly complex, strategic new product development projects. This role will work in close alignment with global and regional sourcing teams to ensure BD is positioned well to provide innovative products and solutions to our customers longer term. In summary, this role will Collaborate with assigned business unit on their future product and technology portfolios and engage external partners to support the future portfolio Collaborate with category management teams and/or GP Business Partner teams to coordinate and execute supplier innovation summits Attend business unit Innovation Council and partnering with Business Development and R&D leadership Be accountable for the overall sourcing strategy for highly complex and strategic new product development projects, contributing to the projects’ commercial success as part of the GDPS core team Act as single point of contact and represent all aspects of strategic procurement for assigned new product development projects Manage 2-3 complex NPD projects and Advance Innovation area for EMI space globally. Job Responsibilities Perform market and supply base sensing for future product innovation and technology portfolios Active participation in external innovation forums or events linked to BD’s strategic portfolios Perform benchmarking with other applicable industries to bring new ideas and technology to BD Active partnering where applicable with universities working with BD on R&D related activities Attend business unit Innovation Councils Organize and/or actively participate in technology or innovation days with applicable business For highly complex new product development project execute pre-launch activities such as commercial aspects of supplier qualification and supplier development in close collaboration with R&D, cross-functional operations teams as well as category/procurement teams Responsible to elaborate and align with the business and project leaders on “procurement source plan” deliverables by project according to GPDS process Improves BD's financial position through procurement related project deliverables, cost savings, non-price value opportunities and risk mitigation impacting R&D and New Product Development teams Responsible for creating and managing Development Agreements, SOW, Supply Agreements, Master Service Agreements, among others related with new project development Partnering with Procurement Analytics Design to Value team to optimize cost and increase value for the customer Create and elaborate Make vs. Buy analysis with a cross functional teams for each project Coordinate and obtain CDA, RFI, RFQ, Cost Model, Clean Sheet and Cost estimation for each project Responsible for managing supplier due diligence for development and qualification activities Sphere Of Influence Where applicable, establishes initial within BD’s electronical mechanical systems or medical device related systems. The individual will leverage BD’s external partners to support innovation within the scope of the role (i.e. EMS or device). This role will also provide comprehensive Procurement support for key new product development projects using assigned technology. Accountable For Procurement related activities for strategic, complex new product development projects to ensure optimized cost and maximize revenue post launch Collaborating with external partners to bring innovation into BD to support product and technology portfolios Reduce risk of supply and ensure quality of material coming in from external partners for future strategic, high revenue products Supports higher gross profits for key future products by optimizing raw material costs Provide budgetary COGS estimates and pricing used for financial models Optimize costs for raw materials and other R&D expenses such as design services Our Requirements Bachelor’s degree or master’s degree in engineering or Procurement Minimum 10 years of work experience in R&D, strategic sourcing, supplier development, new product development and innovation experience and methodology Strong influencing and communication skills within a highly matrixed and multi-cultural organization Ability to deal with ambiguity and complexity High cross-functional understanding of New Product Development, R&D, Manufacturing, Quality, Regulatory, Supply Chain processes and standards Strong business and commercial acumen and result oriented Excellent project management and problem-solving skills Culture And Benefits Here at BD, we embrace a growth mindset, building capabilities for the future and helping you become the best version of yourself. Job_Title: VP, Business Banking Marketing | Personal Financial Services
Job_Descriptions: About the Department The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services. Personal Financial Services We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations. Job Responsibilities Seeking to hire a Vice President (VP) within UOB’s Group Retail Marketing team who will oversee and manage all marketing activities and campaigns related to secured and unsecured lending, trade and bancassurance products and solutions that the bank offers to SME clients within its Business Banking segment. The individual will have to work closely with stakeholders across the product, portfolio, customer experience and channels teams in the bank to develop and execute campaigns to help generate leads, drive client acquisition and deepen client engagement. At the same time, he/she is responsible for marketing activities aimed at driving awareness, signups/installs and usage of the bank’s digital platforms designed to help SMEs perform their banking transactions and business operations seamlessly. Specifically, this individual is also tasked with continuous marketing activities aimed at establishing the bank’s thought leadership and expertise in partnering SMEs through the creation, curation and communication of content that showcases its value proposition to prospects and existing clients. When running campaigns, he/she will be required to provide clear direction and work with creative and social agencies to develop effective assets across the full range of paid and owned channels. He/she will also be expected to have experience and capabilities across traditional and digital marketing, working with the media agency to determine the media mix, target and retarget audiences effectively; and optimise media spends for campaigns. The individual is likewise responsible for managing allocated marketing budgets, including monitoring the marketing effectiveness of spends in driving marketing and business objectives. Job Requirements At least 8 years of marketing experience in a financial institution (FI) or managing FI accounts in a creative agency Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business or Economics Demonstrate creativity and the ability to express opinions on creative work; strong digital and social media marketing experience is essential Good understanding of SME banking products is preferable Robust project management skills – able to prioritise and manage multiple projects in a fast paced environment while maintaining attention to detail Possess business acumen, with a keen eye on the competitive landscape and a strong ability to help drive results while adapting to business needs and challenges Strong communicator (written and spoken) who is able to build and deepen internal and external stakeholder relationships Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. Public Policy Senior Manager Who are we? Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed. We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents. A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. We are more than a legal team protecting Equinix’s interests. We are valued business partners, known as responsive, consistent and proactive. We take customer service seriously and strive for excellence in our execution. Our strong relationships with our internal and external clients, fueled by our solution-driven orientation and creative yet practical advice, bring us to the table “early and often” and lead to interesting and rewarding work directly in support of Equinix’s strategy. At Equinix, we are proud to be recognized as one of the Top 100 Places to Work for 2021 by Glassdoor. We are also proud to rank among the top JUST100 companies in the U.S. stock market on environmental, social and governance metrics. The One Legal team at Equinix is seeking a Senior Manager, Public Policy. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced candidate to help build our public policy agenda and then interact with political and policy leaders and government officials to explain our products and services and promote the growth of internet infrastructure. Responsibilities The successful candidate will provide leadership in the following key areas: Internal engagement Identify emerging public policy issues related to the Company’s mid- and long-term business plans and develop internal and external policy positions, strategies and analysis to influence the external landscape and advance the Company’s business priorities. Participate in the development of the Company’s public policy agenda through regular meetings and ongoing communications with the Company’s senior leadership team. Develop strong working relationships with the Company’s country Managing Directors (MDs) across the region. Support the MDs on policy issue development, messaging, trade association and coalition relationships, and policy maker engagement. Assure consistency of messaging and policy positioning across entire region. Develop strong working relationships with the Company’s global and regional functions on Sustainability, Legal Regulatory, Operations, Communications, Business Development and other key functions in order to assure cross-functional alignment and leverage. Identify and recommend alignment of the Company’s activities and priorities to intersect with evolving public policy trends. Contribute to internal processes for handling public policy matters that arise on an emergency or unexpected basis so that the Company is prepared to respond in such cases. External Engagement Help manage day-to-day portfolio of the Company’s public policy agenda at various levels of government and in various regions where the Company maintains a physical presence and where the Company does business. Participate in and advocate for public policy coalitions and trade associations aligned with the Company’s public policy agenda. Serve as a key point of contact for the Company’s participation and/or support the participation of Company senior executives in those organizations. Develop working relationships with key policy makers and regulators and their staffs to effectively advocate the Company’s public policy agenda. Participate in government public consultation exercises and work on public policy submissions (including those on regulatory initiatives and/or developments) directly with governments or via public policy coalitions and trade associations. Education and Training Develop internal resources to educate employees about the Company’s public policy agenda. Work with the Company’s public relations team and others to develop a robust set of materials that: Educate policymakers about the Company’s business objectives, its importance to the foundational operations of the Internet, and its plans for future growth. Position the Company as a thought leader on central issues of importance to the Company. Emphasize the positive economic and cultural benefits of the Company’s global growth. Promote the Company’s commitment to sustainability and advocate for the opportunities digital transformation and the move to cloud and colocation have for efficiency and sustainability progress. Promote the Company’s commitment to Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging (DIB) to develop a diverse, empowered, and effective workforce in order to address the needs of our communities. Qualifications 5+ years of experience in government relations or public policy positions; prior service in government legislative/regulatory bodies a plus. Bachelor’s degree; law or master’s degree a plus. Exposure to policy issues in the areas of: Technology and the Internet; Cybersecurity and data privacy; Energy, environment, sustainability, circular economy policies, principles and corporate frameworks; Government procurement policy; and National and local Tax Policy. Demonstrated high level of integrity, thoroughness, flexibility, initiative and teamwork. Demonstrated self-guided initiative. Excellent written and oral communication skills and interpersonal communication skills. Excellent judgment. Expectation for regular travel within the region to locations where Equinix has a presence. Periodic travel to Company headquarters and Washington, DC as required. Visit our Career page here to understand about Equinix COVID-19 Vaccine Policy.

Location: Arab Street, Rochor, Singapore, 199755, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description About Motion Art Space Motion Art Space is a fast-growing art jamming startup featuring the original spinners and motion paintings in Singapore. Are you an experienced in recruiting professional talent looking to step up in your career and join a high performing recruitment team? Join Cielo as Senior Recruiter! A career at Cielo will give you the opportunity to work with the industry’s smartest people and to take ownership of your success! Our client, a global leader in professional services is looking for a Senior Recruiter to be based in Singapore, hybrid working model with us! The Senior Recruiter is responsible for Service Excellence throughout the recruitment cycle. The Senior Recruiter acts as a brand ambassador for their client and partners with the hiring managers in a consultative capacity. They are focused on delivering top talent for their hiring managers while providing proactive and timely communication on the status of the search. The Senior Recruiter is expected to stay abreast of industry and market specific information or trends that could impact the search. They will act as a mentor to Recruiters as well as other team members. They demonstrate innovation and outside of the box thinking with their search techniques. Responsibilities Finding Candidates: Complete a detailed job scope conversation with the hiring leader to determine position specifications. Timely review of applicants who have applied via the applicant tracking system. Build and deploy effective recruitment marketing campaigns specific to the job opening. Source candidates via resume databases and networking sites using sophisticated Boolean search language. Source candidates via social media channels and deep web sourcing techniques. Generate targeted lists of passive candidates using member subscriptions and technologies. Solicit and pursue referrals from business networks and/or internal referrals. Utilize proprietary software for mobile and email campaigning to talent communities Engaging Candidates: Use a sophisticated mix of media to connect with talent community (phone, email, campaigning, network introductions and social media). Provide value propositions uniquely tailored to each candidate situation and interest level in the job. Prepare candidates for interviews; providing logistical information, interview schedule, appropriate attire and expectations for follow up from the recruiter; additional counsel as needed. Ensure all candidates are provided with timely updates concerning the status of their applications and interviews. Throughout the process, keeps a strong pulse on the interest levels and/or concerns of top candidates. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s degree in business, management, human resources or related field required. Equivalent experience may be considered. Experience: Minimum of five or more years results-oriented recruiting experience working in an in-house, RPO or agency setting. Ability to showcase niche segment or industry expertise. Ability to employ technologies in the recruiting process that create efficiencies. Adhere to documentation and processes for compliance. Experience utilizing deep web sourcing techniques.

Position Overview: We are looking for self-motivated and self-starting engineers to join our team to design, implement, integrate, test, qualify and maintain embedded software for edge AI systems. For this role, the scope is biased towards verification and validation at unit, component and system level; * take in SRS/FRD and translate it into a corresponding test plan. * put in place suitable test strategy. * design and implement test cases. * execute and report on the test results. * work with unit developers on improvement in coding techniques, design patterns, test assertion, etc. * work with the entire team on continuous improvement of the quality of our deliverables. To excel, you need to have a good grasp of test effectiveness and test efficiency; * an eye for details; appreciation of Murphy's Law and identify test (failure) corners in a systematic manner, aside from normal operating conditions. * solid practitioner of test automation. This position is not entirely about embedded software testing though; you will also contribute in unit design and implement per project's need. Responsibilities: 1. Responsible for verification and validation at unit, component and system level. 2. Responsible for test plan, design, implementation, execution and reporting. 3. Support team in matters relating to CI/CD. 4. Support team in unit design and implementation. 5. Plan and coordinate projects with teams globally and execute independently. Requirements: Candidate qualifications include: * Excellent coding skills with C and/or C++ is a given. * Good understanding of various test coverage metrics. * Good experience with Bash and/or Python for automation purpose. * Experience with source code management (GIT, SVN). * Experience with any RTOS. * Knowledge of test management system (e.g. TestRail) is a plus. * Knowledge of testing framework like Unity and CMocka is a plus. * Knowledge of Confluence/JIRA is a plus. * Knowledge of GitLab CI/CD is a plus. * Knowledge of ASPICE compliance workflow is a plus. * Knowledge of ML at the compute level is a plus. Promising fresh from EE/CE are welcomed to apply; suitable mentoring and coaching will be provided to kick start your career in embedded software engineering with a focus on edge AI deployment.

Network Service Engineer II Who are we? Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed. We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents. Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best in class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success. Job Summary: Part of a wider Global Technical Assistance department, this role will have responsibility to operate, monitor and support Equinix networks across EMEA/APAC/AMER regions. Performing 2nd and 3rd level troubleshooting to resolve system & network performance related issues, whilst driving continuous service improvements and working closely with the Service Delivery Team to ensure an outstanding service to all partners. To support the 24 hour nature of the business, this position will participate in an on-call rotation and although predominantly office based there are times when you will be required to work in our data centers. Responsibilities Drive incident and problem to root cause, document, follow up and track on remedial/preventive actions Interface between Network Engineering departments and SMC. Collaborate with partners, carrier providers and our hardware vendors to manage and troubleshoot the network (circuits, cross connects and trouble case management) Drive tool improvement and new features request. Reviews the metrics and proactively identifies opportunities to improve the efficiency of the Network Engineering departments. Monitor and review network performance, reliability and security. Troubleshooting of Network issues, supporting SMC – Service Engineering team and Customers. Identify operational issues and suggest design alterations to address these issues. Working in a distributed GLOBAL Network operation support team. Schedule network maintenances (CMR’s), including MOP’s and upgrades driven through the global change management process and implement error free environment. Creates and modifies the documented guidelines, cheat sheets used by the Ops team, etc and providing training for new starters. The role is typical in office environment but requires sometimes to work in our data centers. This position will participate in on call rotation to support network incident resolution. May perform other duties as assigned. Requirements Essential Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related discipline 3-5 years of experience in the field of Networking/Telco preferably with operational experience in an ISP/Carrier environment. Multi-Vendor knowledge for Infinera, Ciena, Cisco (Photonics/NCS), Nokia and Juniper. In-depth knowledge of Optical Transport Networks SDH/OTN/DWDM transmission systems including passive optical networks, coherent transponders, Flexible Photonic Architectures, EDFAs amplifiers and ROADM. Deep knowledge of, Packet Based Networks, Routing, Redundancy Protocols like, OSPF, BGP, VRRP, MPLS, Ethernet Applied expert knowledge of LAN, WAN, internet technologies Must be able to manage multiple projects concurrently, work under deadlines, maintain budget, and be able to produce under a mission critical environment. Fluent English in speaking and writing is required Excellent verbal and written communication skills Project planning and management skills, including ability to identify and assess risks Flexibility Perform on-call support Desirable Skills on UNIX, Linux and monitoring tools and programming languages Experience with Ciena 6500, Waveserver Classic/Ai/5, Infinera DTN, Coriant G30. Experience with Ciena MCP Experience with Infinera DNA Security background configuring Firewalls ITILv3 Visit our Career page here to understand about Equinix COVID-19 Vaccine Policy.

Job_Descriptions: Job Descriptions: Maintains records of hazardous waste, air emission permitting, and water pollution discharge, as well as industrial health monitoring and records of employee hazard exposure. Maintains contingency plans, including fire prevention, and procedures for controlling hazardous spills in accordance with government regulation and insurance company requirements. Previous leadership, coaching, or mentoring experience. Certified Safety Professional (CSP) preferred. Knowledge of regulatory requirements from government agencies, such as MOM, SCDF and NEA. Knowledge of experience in international management systems such as SS506, ISO 14001, ISO 45001. Ability to work effectively with regulatory agencies. Excellent skills in written and oral communication. Basic computer skills with both Microsoft Office and database applications. Fire Safety Manager (FSM) Certification from the Singapore Civil Defense Force (SCDF) Registered Workplace Safety and Health Officer (WSHO) with the Ministry of Manpower, Singapore Completed and pass Management of Hazardous Substances course. Completed and pass Site Incident Controller (SIC) course.

Looking for a research fellow or research engineer to bring technical programming chops in the areas of computer graphics and immersive technologies (AR/VR/MR/XR), and to implement advanced usability scenarios with immersive technologies on high-speed broadband cellular networks. You will work on a specific project and also amongst a diverse team of faculty members, engineers, industry partners and students. Technical skills, tremendous git-fu, versatility and enthusiasm are highly desired traits that will enable you to succeed in this fast-paced environment. SIT has a strong applied research focus in usability and immersive technologies, with a diverse pool of interdisciplinary projects that work hand-in-hand with their industry partners. Key Responsibilities: Design and create custom Virtual Reality (VR) interaction methods and 3D environments Design and develop research VR software artifacts and outcomes Lead engineers and students to develop research software artifacts and outcomes Manage research and implementation projects including development of features or publications Procure and maintain equipment, software or related items Job Requirements: Experience in developing in Unity 3D or similar game engines and domains related to immersive technologies (e.g., virtual, augmented, mixed realities) Knowledge of working in an Agile development team (e.g. Scrum and/or TDD) and with software version control Experience in designing complex solutions for complete digital environments will be advantageous Around 2-3 years of work experience in VR/AR projects and UX design Applicants with equivalent industry experience may be considered Preferably a Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering or equivalent

Looking for a research fellow or research engineer to bring fresh perspectives in the areas of UX, human-computer interaction, computer graphics and immersive technologies (AR/VR/MR/XR), and to investigate advanced usability scenarios and how immersive technologies can make an impact on high-speed broadband cellular networks. You will work on a specific project and also amongst a diverse team of faculty members, engineers, industry partners and students. Versatility, enthusiasm, technical skills and leadership qualities are highly desired traits that will enable you to succeed in this fast-paced environment. SIT has a strong applied research focus in usability and immersive technologies, with a diverse pool of interdisciplinary projects that work hand-in-hand with their industry partners. Key Responsibilities : Design and conduct research experiments to address research questions Lead and support high quality publications to disseminate the applied research outcomes Lead engineers and students to develop research software artifacts and outcomes Manage research and implementation projects including development of features required, tracking progress, and measuring impact Job Requirements: Prior research experience in the areas of human-computer interaction, computer vision, computer graphics as well as related areas. Demonstrated abilities in managing research projects on the ground end-to-end, from defining research questions to publishing results Implementation experience in applied domains related to immersive technologies (e.g., virtual, augmented, mixed realities) Preferably a Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering or equivalent
