Job Description The RedMart tech team is responsible for offering the best online supermarket shopping experience for our customers. We manage the RedMart channel within Lazada app and we build our mobile app and some of the supporting APIs, as well as cover search technologies, recommendation services and more, to ensure the overall e-commerce system can scale to support our growth and high traffic and deliver a great customer experience. We are also responsible for delivering this experience in multiple countries in SEA. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering the best customer experience in the Android app, including design, robust technical solution implementation, testing, and documentation. You will have ownership of a product that has thousands of daily active users. The ideal candidate is an expert in Android programming with experience in iOS and other mobile technologies, with strong opinions on backend APIs, user experience & scalable component-driven design. We are looking for world class engineer who has a passion to create, is highly ambitious, and willing to work hard to achieve great things. As a Senior Android Engineer you will: Work as part of a small team that has ownership of a product, an important initiative, or part of the business. You’ll need to have superb communication skills and thrive in a collaborative environment and be committed to the success of the team as a whole. Learn the business and get close to users and customers and build close relationships with the business stakeholders for your domain. Design, implement and test robust features on the Android App. Write clean code that’s testable, maintainable, solves the right problem, and does it well. Code you can be proud of. Mentor & train junior engineers in the team on adopting the right engineering practices. Have the opportunity to and be expected to innovate and demonstrate your creativity. Do you have ideas on how to improve the customer shopping experience or effectively use new technology? Can you find a way to do what others thought impossible? Job Requirements What do we look for in a candidate? 5 years of experience as an Android engineer; Perseverance. Building a great company that customers love is hard work. Many challenges await and we are looking for team members we can count on when things get tough. Impact. We are result-oriented. We value people who focus on the right things and get them done. Strong coding and design ability. You write code that's clean and well structured. Your designs are pragmatic, appropriate to the problem at hand, but can also be evolved over time. Strong sense of design and user-centered perspective. Passion for technology. Our developers are always evaluating new tools and technologies that can make us better. What has attracted your interest lately? Use of best practices such as TDD, BDD, continuous integration, continuous deployment. Strong verbal and written communication skills.​If you get gains please give a like

Job_Title: Head of Structure Finance - Gas & Power Energy Group
Job_Descriptions: Newly created position Structuring of bilateral trade/ structure finance High visibility Described as a highly ambitious gas & power energy group with a strong commitment to future energies, Singapore serves as the Asia Pacific Headquarters and a key location for treasury and financing. In a bid to optimize the Group's network and financial strengths, the Company is now looking to hire a Head of Structured Finance. Reporting to the Group Treasurer, the Head of Structured Finance will manage the leadership and oversight of all operational staff aspects of the structured finance, which includes structuring of bilateral trade/ structured finance facilities, setting up of trade/ structured finance operations as well as banking relationships. He/ She will work alongside the trading and the business development teams to develop financing and structuring solutions for their clients, as well as driving the relationships with commodity financial institutions and intermediaries in Asia. The Head of Structured Finance will also play an active role in advisory, risk and compliance management, working with Credit, Head Office and insurers to identify and execute risk mitigation strategies. The successful candidate must possess a tertiary degree in a finance discipline, with at least 10 years' structured trade finance and treasury experience within Energy Trading in a senior capacity. You will be described as having proven experience of negotiating structured/ trade finance facilities with banks in the region. You will also demonstrate a strong understanding of risk management and extensive cross functional engagement with stakeholders outside of treasury and finance. Due to the need to deal with significant number of Chinese stakeholders and customers, fluency in Mandarin is essential. To apply, please submit your resume to Ailing Huang at **@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number AH22082. Only successful shortlisted candidates will be notified. Job_Title: International Private Bank – Relationship Manager, South East Asia - Director/VP
Job_Descriptions: Position Overview Details of the Division and Team: Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management business is one of the largest wealth managers worldwide. We offer our clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Wealth Management. As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations, we create lasting value for clients. We specialize in developing bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits. All this is possible thanks to our global network, our many years of experience and our close collaboration with the Corporate Bank, Investment Bank and DWS. We aim to become a highly competitive global wealth manager by combining financial strength and stability with trustworthy partnership and forward-thinking in order to build sustainable and beneficial client relationships. As a growth business for Deutsche Bank, we contribute towards building a more balanced, less capital intense and stable business model for the bank. The Relationship Manager is a primary point of contact for clients to access the entire suite of wealth management capabilities and solutions offered by Deutsche Bank Wealth Management. This is achieved by working in close partnership with the Investment Manager in the day-to-day planning and servicing for the client. The individual is responsible for acquiring new clients - which are in line with the business proposition of the bank - and assets as well as grow existing business relationships, assuring a holistic and high-standard client experience. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. You can expect: Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement Your key responsibilities: Develop, manage and maintain overall relationship with the client, providing an holistic client experience Be the first point of contact and the overall responsible person with regard to dealing with client complaints Develop new business with new and existing clients, spending a great proportion of time focused on bringing in new clients and new assets (prospecting), building and sustaining long-term relationships Work as a team with the Investment Manager (and the Institutional Wealth Partner where appropriate) to build deeper client relationships / involve in origination Keep day-to-day responsibility for advising clients within the required regulatory framework and keeping abreast of all client-impacting initiatives from the respective market Proactively identifying client lending / financing needs, involving lending specialists to further develop the opportunity Perform continuous market analysis to identify potential client leads and opportunities Act as the Accountable Client Owner with responsibility for all AML aspects of the client relationship; this includes KYC in good quality and in a timely manner (no overdues) as well as account behavior, i.e. transactions with focus on 3rd party transactions constituting transfers in and out to be in line with purpose and anticipated behavior of the account(s). Where clients are not assigned an Investment Manager, own the overall suitability and appropriateness for client investments; taking client execution orders where required and ensuring that all corresponding checks are performed Participate in relevant client social events as well as in PR and other marketing activities Uphold the team’s operating rhythm (e.g. regular prospect review, pipeline review, account planning, etc.), leading by example and demonstrating role-model behavior Work in close co-operation with other coverage, product and support functions to deliver DB’s value proposition, leveraging also other DB divisions where possible Actively support the business / growth strategy, plans and values, contributing to the achievement of a high performing team Act within professional, legal and ethical boundaries and guidelines, observing all internal and external compliance regulations and code of ethics and conduct; flagging and managing reputational risks and conflicts issues Your skills and experience: Minimum 8 years of relevant experience for Director and above Minimum 5 or more years of relevant experience for Vice President Solid network of clients in the target coverage market is required, specifically South East Asia Fluency (written and oral) in English and other languages used in the target coverage market required Detail orientation on both strategy and execution Excellent communication skills Excellent collaboration skills Superior investment acumen Have a good understanding of the governing regulatory framework (e.g. RDR, MiFID II, etc.), including but not limited to applicable confidentiality / secrecy / data protection regulations and cross border rules where relevant Professional integrity For experienced hire, solid network of clients in the target coverage market is required Self-starter Willing and able to develop other staff, e.g., analysts CFA, MBA degree or other advanced degree a plus How we’ll support you: Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs Training and development to help you excel in your career About us and our teams: Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. click here to see what we do. Deutsche Bank & Diversity Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer. We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation. Click here to find out more about diversity and inclusion at Deutsche Bank.

Sales Specialist - Powerflex Solutions Some of our most valuable business comes from existing customers. That’s because our Business Development Sales team takes care to forge strong and insightful relationships with them. To gain understanding of the unique and changing factors that drive purchasing decisions, the team develops connections at all levels of a client’s business. They use their insight to identify and create new opportunities – and to build the business development strategies that underpin successful sales. As well as maximizing revenue, they take responsibility for accurate forecasts. Join us as a Sales Specialist on our Business Development - Sales team in NSW to do the best work of your career. What you’ll achieve As an Account Executive, you will identify and develop new strategic opportunities with existing clients. You will develop strong relationships with key customer contacts at all levels of the business to gain an understanding of key business drivers that influence purchasing decisions. You will: Focus on strategic business to further advance sales strategies Influence the customer’s buying potential at the senior leadership level Work with application vendors to get products and services bundled in a solution Build long term relationships with key stakeholders Have an advanced understanding of product and services portfolios Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements 8 to 12 years of experience in a relationship selling role Ability to negotiate contracts, develop vendor quotes and pricing models In depth knowledge of technology, products and services to help customers formulate strategy and direction Work cross-functionally to meet customer needs Desirable Requirements Field sales experience preferred Bachelor’s degree Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here. Job_Title: Head of Sales, Direct to Customer
Job_Descriptions: PURPOSE This is a senior role in the organisation leading and owning the DTC sales numbers. The role is responsible to drive DTC sales across general and life insurance products, defining sales processes, website customer sales journeys, improve per customer policy holdings by planning and driving cross sell initiatives, partnerships (affiliate, affinity and eco-system), planning sales campaigns, develop sales strategy, budget management and cost optimisation. Understanding and excelling in digital journeys, experience sales campaigns for the target customer segments and ecommerce sales conversions (constant optimisation and analysis) is important for success in this role. Key Accountabilities: Drive the digital sales channel across Life and GI. Own the sales numbers and work closely with the product and actuarial team to get an optimal mix between sales, CPA and profitability Plan, implement and monitor digital sales campaigns on the website and with partners. Work with the Performance Marketing team to define and lead the digital marketing strategy, target audience, sales messaging, budget and media mix Collaborate with the brand and product advertising team for campaigns and awareness strategy as this is the main driver of traffic to the site for quotes and sales Optimize quotes to sales conversion across channels and products (by looking into supporting data: GA funnel, payment failures, sales journey, contact centre calling status prioritization) Identify new campaigns and channels we want to test Identify potential new partnerships in the digital space considering the factors like (website visits, competitors’ presence, investment and tech capabilities) Optimise performance of existing partners by monitoring sales, conversion, expense and identifying new marketing opportunities Put together and analyse sales tracking/sales funnel and reporting with the data analytics team Define sales flow with the UI/UX team for new products by considering customer research, user testing and focus groups studies Ensure that the digital campaigns, sales promotions and sales contact centre support are well coordinated and aligned on business priorities, sales messaging and optimizing conversions Sales planning, budgeting and forecasting on a continuous basis Responsible for sales messaging, target segment and defining campaign objectives for DTC across the website, app and sales campaigns QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or relevant field Minimum 10 years of experience in driving sales in DTC segment/ecommerce sales Experience in insurance industry will be a plus, but is not mandatory Proven ability to: Drive and identify business opportunities and strategic approaches Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure, especially during peak hours or intense situations Effectively facilitate discussions among multiple stakeholders and manage peer groups / project teams (without direct line reporting) KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITY In-depth knowledge of various digital marketing tools and social media platforms, best practices and website analytics Solid understanding of eCommerce, sales processes, cross sell and retention strategies, cost optimisation, digital and ecosystem partnerships Working knowledge of web journey principles, best practices, and content management platforms Familiarity with analytical tools, such as Google Analytics and Webmaster Tools Good with numbers, projections, and sales analysis Strong presentation and negotiation skills Effective verbal and written communication

Job Responsibilities UOB Asset Manment Ltd (UOBAM) currently requires an individual who is result focused with strong interest in delivering customer success for our digital investment platform and app to join the UOBAM Invest team. UOBAM Invest offers both a corporate investment platform and an individual digital advisory mobile app in Singapore. Job Description The Project Engineer will be in charge to manage onsite construction related coordination activities, with an immediate emphasis on the build-out of commercial kitchen and laundry equipment in a high end 5-star hotel project.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: interfacing with clients, consultants, main contractor and various other trade subcontractors, design team, and all applicable entities; maintaining schedules; maintaining proper project documentation, cost controls and quality of work. The position requires a minimum 2 years of experience managing commercial kitchen equipment fit-out construction. Job Responsibilities Report to Project Manager on all elements of risk associated with scope, schedule, and budget. Work closely with other project team members including other project engineers, drafting and site safety supervisor assigned to the project. Manage all subcontractors on-site construction activities as the designated Project Manager. Monitor daily work activities of the various subcontractors to ensure proper adherence to job site safety policies and procedures. Coordinate with the subcontractors to maintain the project schedule in an attempt to avoid potential delays, achieve milestones and meet completion dates. Develop and evaluate project schedules. Manage meetings and correspondence with consultants / Clients / Main Contractor. Participate with the project team to ensure timely coordination of submittals, requests for information (RFI’s) and plan revisions. Monitor and inspect work progress for quality control and quality assurance; identify and resolve problem issues in a timely manner. Participate in weekly progress meetings; review subcon payment applications; review and resolve change order requests. Assist Project Manager to prepare and submit monthly progress claim and liaise closely with QS for work done certification of site progress. Work closely with the team to fulfil all requirement and expectation during testing and commissioning with consultant. Assist Project Manager and other project team members to close out project for handover with OMM and as-built documentation submission. Job Requirement: Minimum (3) years field construction experience working as a Project Engineer Commercial Kitchen equipment fit-out construction: 2 years Knowledgeable in general building and site/civil construction Knowledge of reading project plans and specifications, including interior design detailing. Possess Bachelor Degree / Diploma in Mechanical Engineering Past experience working on large construction projects is an added advantage Proficient with Microsoft Office and other basic computer skills

If you love to play the leading role in driving IT innovations for the Wildlife Industry, we invite you to join us at Mastermark Pte Ltd for a ‘wildly’ exciting IT career! About the Role The Supervisor reports to the Executive/ Assistant Contract Manager/ Contract Manager and is responsible for his/ her subordinates who are the Senior Facility Services Specialist, Facility Services Specialist, housekeepers, project staff and team leader. Job Responsibilities Project a professional image at all times. Practice Greet, Smile and Thank (GST) patients, staff and all who come into contact. Ensure the team complies with grooming standards and adhere on Health & Safety requirements in respect of uniforms and safety work practices as well as procedures to provide a clean, safe working environment. Check and update daily attendance of staff reporting for duty and deploy staff to respective area and ensure that all areas are adequately manned. Conduct daily briefing and provide reminders and to ensure that staff are up to date with daily information and instructions. Conduct daily inspections of all areas including rooms under supervision to ensure that all Environmental Services assignments are carried through. Coordinate fault reporting and repairs between ward staff, housekeepers and FME department. Troubleshoot equipment malfunctions. Review and ensure completion of maintenance cleaning requests is completed within the specified standards, and within the agreed time frame and frequency. Ensure that staff supervised is issued with appropriate tools and equipment in excellent working condition to undertake their duties. Check and update records of cleaning materials such as bath mats and mops submitted by housekeepers. Ensure sufficient stocks at all times. Check daily reports (e.g. FSS Daily Reports, Housekeepers Daily Worksheet, Turnover Time, etc) and follow up accordingly. Keep track on overtime performed by housekeepers, calculate and submit the details to admin office (payroll) for processing and payment (twice monthly) Prepare and maintain records of staff supervised (i.e. timesheets, tasks records, materials and clothing issues, etc). Prepare and submit daily/ weekly/ monthly reports and customer feedback records. Coach and train staff in need so that their performance would meet standards stipulated. Conduct performance appraisal, recommend for promotion or increment for deserving staff. Enforce safety rules and regulations. Promptly report accidents/ incidents to the superior without delay. Coordinate customers’ feedback and requests and ensure that there is a follow up to the complaints and requests. Conduct patient satisfaction interviews with patients. Attend and participate in staff meetings and training to keep track with changes in cleaning procedures and disseminate such information to staff under supervision. Undertake any duties/ projects, etc as and when requested by the Assistant Contract Manager/ Contract Manager. Job Requirements Secondary School Education or closely related field with minimum 3 or more years of supervisory experiences with emphasis on complete cleaning in a hospital environment, large facility services industry or large commercial contracts. Candidates without the above minimum requirements on education but with relevant experiences can be considered for the position. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced challenging hospital environment and with the ability to organize, manage, supervising a small group of staff for facility services projects. Require long periods of standing, walking, bending when inspection of walk and ability to follow oral instructions, read and comprehend written instructions to carry out assignments. Knowledge of training of buffer, vacuum, shampooer and other cleaning activities will be an added advantage.

Global Supply Management Advisor Global supply at one of the world’s largest technology companies is no small challenge. It’s complex, fast moving, ever changing and above all exciting. It keeps our people on their toes. Our Global Supply Management team within Materials and Procurement takes charge of global supply planning for specific platforms and commodity areas. Focused on business goals and objectives, we take the lead in supplier selection, product delivery specifications and quality. We succeed through our ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships with global internal and external supply chain partners. Join us as a Global Supply Management Advisor on our Global Supply Management team in Singapore to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. What you’ll achieve As a Global Supply Management Advisor, you will be responsible for providing procurement expertise to ensure optimized supply chain strategies across multiple programs. You will: Be responsible for commodity continuity of supply Acts as a single point of contact for all commodity related demand and supply issues/ requirements. Interfaces with Demand Planning organization to gather commodity demand requirements and trends. Participates in commodity management and core team meetings to support supply manager action items for all product development Coordinates with Global Commodity Managers to drive the commodity COS strategy Works with the suppliers to negotiate the lead time and other supply requirements, and communicates the supply plan to internal stakeholders Works with buyers and suppliers to ensure COS is maintained at all the build sites Accountable for supplier’s operational performance business and uses the commodity Quarterly Business Review (QBR) process to manage supplier performance Support new part qualification, as required per commodity strategy Inventory Management Plans, manages and tracks inventory belonging to the commodity Responsible for aging inventory depletion and E&O working with internal stakeholders Tracks all the commodity risk buys and provides periodic status updates to all stakeholders Support commodity EOQ inventory targets by ensuring inventories are within acceptable range defined by the commodities Industry/Market Trends Follow the industry trends on commodity Keep track of supplier products/roadmaps for the commodity Drive the periodic commodity outlook review with business teams Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements 5 to 8 years of relevant experience Excellent understanding of global supply chain, manufacturing footprint and logistics capabilities Strong program and project management skills Solid supply chain management expertise, negotiation and supplier evaluation skills Deep market research and trends knowledge; as well as a sound understanding of business goals, strategies, and current industry trends Desirable Requirements Bachelors / Masters Degree Subject matter expertise of IT/semiconductor component procurement Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Job_Descriptions: E-Commerce Executive The E-Commerce Executive will be responsible in driving the E-commerce business of UICCP household detergent products as well as agency lines products including baby care, feminine care, adult incontinence and instant noodles. The incumbent will be the main contact person between UICCP and online platform buyers. The ideal candidate should be a quick thinking problem solver and can adapt to the fast paced dynamic business environment. And should have a good understanding of on line FMCG business. Job Description Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow. But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common. An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that makes a real difference – when it matters most. The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever-evolving health and well-being needs. In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better Responsible for the reliability, adherence, maintenance and execution of all Sales/Commercial Operations (End to End) related processes in the APAC market. These processes fall broadly within the key pillars of customer satisfaction with the Commercial/Sales operations, delivery, installation, sales & operation planning, demand /supply balancing, inventory management, order fulfilment, innovation, Project Management, warehousing & distribution and third-party materials management. Responsible for identifying and driving key breakthrough projects/initiatives in the market and integrated supply chain to ensure continued best practice in line with or ahead of market norms. Ensures key capabilities and people competencies are in place and that reporting is timely, standardized and transparent, enabling best practice sharing and rapid problem-solving. Deliver operational excellence in line with Global and Market AOP targets. In this role your key responsibilities would be: Sales Operations; working collaboratively together with the Sales team / BM&S (Business, Marketing & Sales team) on overall contract management, quoting, funnel accuracy and order intake that will be crucial to maximizing our topline performance. Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP); responsible for the functionality and maturity of the S&OP process and the Health Systems sales forecast on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis. Also Customer satisfaction via NPS with the Initial Delivery and installation process Demand planning; overall responsibility for the quality of the demand plan as an output of the S&OP process and managing inventory levels. Supply planning; responsible for regional and locally relevant improvement initiatives to enable sales growth, inventory and logistics costs to maximize the fulfilment of the demand e.g. MOQ reduction. E2E Lead-time reduction. Customer Service and Order Fulfillment; order management, responsible for Customer project Management, the purchasing and supply of all third-party materials and realizing customer satisfaction on the realization of projects in the hospitals and customer sites. Warehousing & distribution; responsible for the performance of the logistics network in respect to GTM(Go to Market), delivery performance and cost optimization and managing the relationship with logistics service providers in the markets. Responsible for implementing customer collaboration processes, in line with the market strategy, that will drive supply chain excellence Responsible for competence development, succession planning, and talent management Bringing innovative initiatives to the APAC market To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience. Master Degree and >15 years of professional experience in Sales Operations, supply chain, finance and operations management. Experience in commercial functions (Project Management, Purchasing, sales, marketing). Certification in Lean, Six Sigma, or Operations management Strong process mindset demonstrated in process improvement role or management of complex business projects. Strong experience in managing multinational / multi-cultural teams in complex business Acts as a role-model for our Philips behaviours : Customer first, Quality & Integrity always, Team up to Win, Take Ownership to deliver fast, Eager to improve and inspire Lead Change: Strong change and program/ project management skills and experience, Strong key stakeholder management on a senior executive level in markets and businesses Deliver Results, Strongly results-oriented drive/ability to gain alignment with all stakeholders. Customer focus and quality minded Strategic/conceptual capability with the ability to collect and summarize the key information into actionable plans. Capable to handle ambiguity and high-pressure levels Flexible International mindset / Relentless focus on driving customer satisfaction. Inspire by Example: Regularly perform Gemba visits in countries and warehousing facilities

About GLOBALFOUNDRIES GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com. Your Job The main role of this position is to provide engineering support to ensure optimum performance of UPW and WWTP system. This includes Project Management, UPW, WWTP installations and capacity upgrading, facility operations problem solving and facilities capacity and asset tracking. The role of the UPW Engineer covers the following areas: Project Management, operations troubleshooting with long term engineering solution, training and water conservation. Systems overseen by the incumbent includes the following: UPW systems, WWTP system, Slurry treatment, Copper treatment system, UPW reclaim system, Drains and Wet Stations and Domestic water systems Essential Responsibilities but not limited to: Responsible for preparing tender specifications, tender interviews, together with the Purchasing department, selection of suitable contractor/vendor and verifying progress claims, based on work on site. Liaising with consultants and authorities while implementing hardening projects, facility work request and support any FAB ramp project.  Manage and lead the FAB UPW and WWTP system Planned shutdown activities. Represent GLOBALFOUNDRIES and protecting the company’s interests in system design, negotiations, project meetings and payment claims. Liaising with the consultant or relevant authorities for required submissions. Develop and review Operational Procedures and review Work Instructions. Generating the required Operational Procedures/ Work Instructions before system hand-over to Fac Operations. Reviewing the Escalation Procedure for minimizing and smooth handling of the system incidents. Formulate FMEA scenarios for each system installed and implement appropriate measures to prevent/reduce potential for system failure. Head QIT/ Technical forum work on system improvement, procedure streamlining, and productivity improvement or cost savings. Preparation of Permits to Work and site verification to ensure housekeeping and Safety regulations are complied with EHS/NEA guidelines. Troubleshooting of UPW/WWTP, drains and related system problems together with cross-functional Facility Operations team and follow up action for long term engineering solution. Provide training for Facility Operation for existing systems and new systems. Carry out Facilities Work requests as assigned. Assist in the preparation of yearly expense and CAPEX budget Tracking of Budget and cost control expenses and utilities that include blanket order and service contracts. Monitoring of SPC by daily reviewing of trends, Preventive Maintenance and logging as well as feedback to Facility Operations. Responsible for the class 1 instrument calibrations coordination and tracking as per QRA requirements. Planning and ordering of critical spares and consumables items for all the UPW/WWTP system. Representation and liaising with auditors for EHS/QRA on regulatory compliance such as ISO 14001, QS 9000, OHSA 18001, TS 16949, customer audit and etc. Representation and liaising with NEA for National regulatory audit. Budget forecast, review and tracking for DI Supplies, Water and Waste Disposal Cost Center. Train and motivate the subordinates to achieve the desired goals and objectives. Contractor permit to work controls, sign off work permit, sign-in/off contractors Provide first line containment action, escalation to relevant, section manager and Fab Operation Maintain a proper housekeeping in all areas in the plant. Other Responsibilities​​​​​​​​​​ Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs Required Qualifications: Degree holder in Chemical, Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics or equivalent. Preferred Experience: Minimum 3 years in similar capacity and working experience in the electronics manufacturing environment. Good interpersonal skill. Ability to lead in meetings with contractors or vendors. GlobalFoundries is an equal opportunity employer, cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We believe having a multicultural workplace enhances productivity, efficiency and innovation whilst our employees feel truly respected, valued and heard. As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or physical abilities. All offers of employment with GlobalFoundries are conditioned upon the successful completion of background checks, medical screenings as applicable and subject to the respective local laws and regulations. To ensure that we maintain a safe and healthy workplace for our GlobalFoundries employees, please note that offered candidates who have applied for jobs in Singapore will have to be fully vaccinated prior to their targeted start date. For new hires, the appointment is contingent upon the provision of a copy of their COVID-19 vaccination document, subject to any written request for medical or religious accommodation.

Description The Renewable Fuels & Feedstocks Market Analyst will provide fundamental commodity market analysis for renewable fuels such as ethanol, biodiesel and renewable diesel (HVO); as well as renewable feedstocks including vegetable oils and their base crops such as palm oil, soybean oil, soybeans, corn oil, corn, canola oil, canola, etc. Other feedstocks market analysis will include tallow and other animal fats, greases and used cooking oil. The fundamental analysis of the evolving Asian carbon credit markets and regulatory programs will be one of the responsibilities in this role and as well as supporting the global trading and business development of renewables, feedstocks and agriculture markets for the Singapore Renewables Trading Desk. The key responsibility of this role is to assist in consolidating the business strategy and plans into concise, coherent means of communication. In addition, this position will interact with Value Chain Supply & Optimization, Emerging Energy, Refining, Marketing, Regulatory & Compliance, Risk, F&PA, the Chief Economists Office, Investor Relations, Commercial Senior Management and Executive Management. Responsibilities May Include Develop a comprehensive understanding of commodity trading, including key supply/demand regions, logistics assets, storage facilities, regulatory/sustainability frameworks and financial instruments used in these markets. The understanding of key trading and development strategies is crucial for success. Communicate market fundamentals, trading strategies and other renewables information with Global Renewables Trading team and Commercial leadership. Assist in the regulatory and sustainability needs of the Singapore Renewables Trading Desk. Understand key trading positions of commodity trading to ensure all aspects of a trading position are understood. Develop and maintain of supply and demand models which involve working closely with the trading function to understand the market and trends, incorporate downtime, seasonal cycles, macroeconomic variables and utilize import/export data to ensure the models are accurate and accepted by trading. Identify market anomalies and communicate to the trading desk on what physical market and forward market changes might occur. Work with third party consultants and brokers to understand and evaluate on their views for renewables markets Gather external business intelligence, analyse and communicate results to assist traders and originators with successful implementation of tactics. Understand and communicate geopolitical and regulatory events/factors which impact price movements. Gather information to assist in development of presentations as needed. Share knowledge freely to improve peers’ group understanding of own niche markets. Lead ad-hoc projects and analysis of market fundamentals (including infrastructure changes) to support trade ideas. Position Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Finance, Economics or Agriculture disciplines 1 or more years’ experience in market analysis Minimum 2 years’ experience in the energy, agriculture or renewables industries with good knowledge of agriculture and renewable fuels Knowledge of commodity trading, refining or petrochemicals industries Familiar with environmental regulatory programs Experience with business development projects Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Some basic understanding of SQL, Tableau, Python, Visual Basic and/or R SQL Proficiency with statistical modeling software, database software, and/or economic modeling Excellent written and oral communication, inter-personal and presentation skills High degree of initiative and collaborative skills Strong analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to quickly evolving requirements Strong ethics, drive and dedication to achieve team and general interests objectives We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Reporting to the Assistant Director (Human Resource), the Learning and Development Manager will support the L&D team in designing and delivering a full spectrum of learning and development initiatives as part of organizational capability development. Being a Learning & Development Business Partner, you would perform strategic L&D consulting to the Clusters/Divisions, offering stakeholders sound, credible and viable advice or solutioning through these strategic engagements. You are also expected to demonstrate professionalism by contributing to the development of our people, through the following L&D portfolio : Job Responsibilities: Developing total learning plan and forecast of annual training budget in line with the University’s strategic goals. Designing, developing, operationalizing and reviewing competency development framework to ensure relevance to institutional and functional needs. Providing value-adding support to division heads and faculty cluster directors in developing our talents. Reviewing and updating learning & development policies. Market research, training vendors’ evaluation, customization, designing and development of training interventions to address L&D needs. Evaluation of programme effectiveness. Conducting orientation programmes for new hires. Conceptualise and implement the collection and analysis of evaluation data pertaining to learners’ behaviour e.g. learning preferences for topics, time of learning etc. for decision making impacting learning design. Implementation of the University’s Modular Training Framework for Corporate Staff by consulting with stakeholders on the creation and maintenance of Learning Pathways/Tracks for staff. Conceptualise and operationalise the Leadership Framework. Perform periodic review of the Leadership Competency Map as part of the Leadership Framework. Perform periodic review of the Talent Development Framework Implement the Talent Development Framework, including talent identification, maintenance of the talent database and organisation of the suite of Talent development programmes to develop the identified talents. Implement leadership and talent development strategies including but not limited to sourcing for and co-developing leadership and talent development programmes and/or relevant experiential learning activities. Manage succession planning exercise in consultation with the Senior Management team and other relevant stakeholders. Perform market scan and research on emerging leadership and talent development trends and adapt relevant leadership practices to augment the University’s leadership and talent development efforts. Undertaking any other related task/duty that may be assigned. Job Requirements: Candidates must possess at least a Bachelor Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree or equivalent. At least 7 years’ experience in similar capacity, preferably in the education industry. Candidate who has a full ACTA qualification and / or have education industry experience will have an added advantage. Familiar with market practices including current and emerging trends in Leadership and talent development and L&D. Possess relevant experience in conceptualising and implementing leadership and talent development framework. Possess relevant experience in succession planning. Demonstrate a keen interest in and is self-driven to maintain currency of knowledge in emerging leadership and talent development trends and practices. Possess relevant experience in implementing change management processes in staff professional development initiatives would be advantageous. Proficient in MS Office application (PowerPoint, Excel & Word). Experience and knowledge of SAP. Excellent interpersonal, planning & organisational skills. Attention to details on the deliverables and being meticulous. Strong presentation skills to both large and small group. Sound organisational and project management skills (i.e. ability to co-ordinate several activities concurrently). A mature, self-driven and empathetic individual, enjoy working in a university environment and an effective team player. Interested candidates are invited to submit their MS Word formatted CV to ******@jondavidsongroup.com. JonDavidson Pte Ltd EA Lic-08C4705 Reg No-R1440770 •

Position Summary Joining Nestlé means you are joining the largest Food and Beverage Company in the world. At our very core, we are a human environment – passionate people driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. A Nestle career empowers you to make an impact locally and globally, as you are provided with the opportunity to make a mark and stand out, as long as you seek it. With Nestle, you are enabled and encouraged to grow not only as professionals, but also as people. As a Demand & Supply Planning Executive, you will be responsible for the demand and supply plans to ensure that customer service and total delivered cost objectives are met. Excellent stakeholder management skills will be required for this role as you will be working closely with various functions on all delivery, inventory and product-related matters to ensure stock availability meets customer requirements. A day in the life of... Generating demand to provide accurate consensus demand plan Working closely with various functions on all delivery, inventory and product-related matters to ensure stock availability to meet customer requirements Monitor and continually improve supplier performance and customer service levels, as well as work on supply chain projects to attain best supply lowest cost for business Review of planning result to ensure fresh stock availability Oversee and ensure that actual stock is within acceptable level and correct stock cover is set Maintain freshness of stock To ensure compliance of best practices and oversee smooth implementation of new SAP version Analyse products sales trend and propose baseline demand plan; Ensure that all events are plan on time, assumptions challenged and properly logged. Ensure that post event evaluation is conducted. Identify gaps and work with Channel business to close gap Conduct weekly demand plan review with channel business and update all demand change Key member of new product launch, providing assumptions and projected demand plan. Weekly update of the response to the new product immediately after launch. Collaborate with DSP manager to ensure Demand Planning best practices are implemented and adhered to. Participate in supply chain efficiency project Timely preparation of all reports to facilitate meeting and action plan What will make you successful Bachelors’ Degree in Supply Chain Logistics Management or equivalent Min 2-3 years demand and supply planning experience in a fast paced FMCG environment Proficient in the use of MS office preferably with experience in SAP and APO Team player with excellent communication and stakeholder management skills Benefits SINGAPORE, SG, 486035
